OUTDESC: "Pope Benedict XVI visited England and Scotland on a four-day Papal visit from 16-19 September 2010" - http://www.thepapalvisit.org.uk/
NARR: Stop Pope Benedict's Visit to the UK is a religious-tolerance campaign aimed at preventing Pope Benedict from visiting the UK, with the initiators, people in the UK, based in the UK, and the target, the British government, also based in the UK. Digital activity consisted of 10,000 petition signatures. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots effort organized around a single petition and supported by members of the British legal community. As of July 9, 2013, the campaign has been completely unsuccessful, since the pope's visit went ahead as planned. JL

TITLE: For Better Care for Georgia's Internally Displaced People
GOALDESC: "[for] the government [halting] evictions [of internally displaced persons in Georgia]" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/
INITDESC: INDIV "Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) who fled the wars over the breakaway regions of Abkhazia and South Ossetia" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/
TARGDESC: "the Ministry of IDPs from the Occupied Territories, Accommodation and Refugees of Georgia" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/
BLOG: One of the bloggers involved in the action, Lilac.ge [GE] writes - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/, http://gabo.ge/archives/1294, http://sivrce.wordpress.com/2011/01/30/%E1%83%93%E1%83%94%E1%83%95%E1%83%9C%E1%83%98%E1%83%9A%E1%83%94%E1%83%91%E1%83%97%E1%83%90%E1%83%9C-%E1%83%92%E1%83%90%E1%83%A2%E1%83%90%E1%83%A0%E1%83%94%E1%83%91%E1%83%A3%E1%83%9A%E1%83%98-%E1%83%9E/, http://shokoladi.ge/content/trtolvita-da-caxcaxit
PARTOFF: "Tented in the yard of the Ministry of IDPs from the Occupied Territories, Accommodation and Refugees of Georgia, several IDPs have been demanding that the government halt evictions" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/, "Every night approximately 3-5 bloggers stay in a tent with IDPs" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/03/georgia-blogger-action-in-support-of-evicted-idps/
OUTDESC: "In 2012, inadequate housing remained one of the main outstanding issues for IDPs" - http://www.internal-displacement.org/countries/georgia
NARR: For Better Care for Georgia's Internally Displaced People is a rights of ethnic minorities and immigrants campaign aimed at stopping evictions of internally displaced people, with the initiators, IDPs, based in Georgia and the target, the Georgian government, also based in Georgia. Digital activity consisted of over 300 Facebook members and various blogs. Offline activity consisted of bloggers visiting IDPs and staying for a short period of time. The structure of the campaign begins with the protesting IDPs and actively engages people like bloggers. As of June 18, 2013, the campaigned has achieved partial success, since the Georgian government agreed to provide some housing subsidies for IDPs but has apparently not agreed to stop evictions if they occur. JL

TITLE: Against Further Oil Exploration in Laguna del Tigre National Park
GOALDESC: "The Laguna del Tigre National Park - a critical reservoir of wetlands and tropical dry forest habitats – is currently threatened by human encroachment, out-of-control fires, and oil exploitation. While the 25-year contract expired, the company Perenco Guatemala LTD is seeking its renewal, but environmentalists and activists are opposing to it strongly", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/09/guatemala-a-tale-of-two-lakes-macaws-and-a-queen/
INITDESC: INDIV "environmentalists and activists are opposing to it strongly, organizing campaigns on Facebook [es] and other websites", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/09/guatemala-a-tale-of-two-lakes-macaws-and-a-queen/; FORMAL " The International Commission of Jurists (ICJ) for Guatemala with the representation of the Environmental and Social Legal Action Center [es](CALAS for its initials in Spanish), filed an Environmental Submission before the Secretariat for Environmental Matters", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/09/guatemala-a-tale-of-two-lakes-macaws-and-a-queen/
PARTOFF: "On behalf of Guatemala, the The International Commission of Jurists (ICJ) for Guatemala with the representation of the Environmental and Social Legal Action Center [es](CALAS for its initials in Spanish), filed an Environmental Submission before the Secretariat for Environmental Matters",http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/09/guatemala-a-tale-of-two-lakes-macaws-and-a-queen/
OUTDESC: (information in Spanish, confirms the failure of the campaign: http://revoluciontrespuntocero.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/INFORME-PERENCO-ESP-.pdf page 20-21)
NARR: Against Further Oil Exploration in Laguna del Tigre National Park is a environmental justice campaign aiming to not renew the contract for an oil company with the initiator(s), two formal envrionmental organizations, based in GTM and CHE and the target(s), the Secretariat for Environmental Matters based in GTM. Digital activity consisted of use of a Facebook group and blogs and a video. No offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as professionally organized by two legitimate organizations; there didn't seem to be much popular support, if the membership numbers of the Facebook group can be cited as evidence. As of June 25, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since there was some consideration on the part of the government, though it appears the oil company did get the contact renewed afterall. DS

TITLE: Recall Labor Attaché Salud
GOALDESC: "demanding for the removal of Salud from his office"  - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/03/philippines-labor-attache-earns-filipino-migrant-communitys-ire/
INITDESC: FORMAL or INFORMAL (no additional info) "a Filipino migrant workers’ association." INDIV "Filipina migrant worker Agnes Tenorio" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/03/philippines-labor-attache-earns-filipino-migrant-communitys-ire/
OUTDESC:
"Overseas Filipino workers are dismayed over the recent decision of the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) dismissing the complaint for abuse of authority and neglect of official duties which they filed against Philippine labor attache Romulo Salud...
The DOLE “admonished and sternly warned” Salud to be more respectful in dealing with people to avoid similar incidents" -  http://bulatlat.com/main/2011/02/05/dole-absolves-official-in-youtube-video-verbally-abusing-ofw-in-hongkong/#sthash.nFlVNMxS.dpuf
NARR: Recall Labor Attaché Salud is an economic justice campaign aiming to remove the Labor attaché from the Philippines consulate in Honk Kong, because of his verbal abuse against a worker. The initiator is a Philipina worker based in Honk Kong. The target is the Department of Labor and Employment Secretary Rosalinda Baldoz based in Manila, Philippines. Digital activity consisted of few videos, a Facebook page and an online petition. Offline activity consisted of a press conference in Honk Kong. The structure of the campaign can best be described as network of support of Pilipino migrants. As of July 2, 2013 the was not successful because the attache Salud was absolved. LS

TITLE: Save Tai Long Beach
GOALDESC: Against "a large private residence was under construction in the upper Sai Wan Village directly behind the beach" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/22/hong-kong-citizen-campaign-to-save-tai-long-beach/
INITDESC: "concerned citizen" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/22/hong-kong-citizen-campaign-to-save-tai-long-beach/
TARGDESC: "local businessman Simon Lo Lin-shing, chairman of Mongolia Energy Corporation." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/22/hong-kong-citizen-campaign-to-save-tai-long-beach/
OUTDESC: "Today Mr. Lo told the mainstream media that he would suspend the construction." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/22/hong-kong-citizen-campaign-to-save-tai-long-beach/
NARR: Save Tai Long Beach is an environmental campaign aiming to stop the construction of a residential complex close from a natural area in Honk Kong –Long Beach-. The initiators are individuals, netizens, that alerted by the new construction created a Facebook group with more than 160K people. They also visited the zone and call supporters to press the government in Hong Kong by phone calls and emails. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a crowd interested in an environmental issue, supported by journalists and academic. As of June 24, 2013 the campaign has achieved its goals, the construction was stopped and the group is pressuring for a permanent ban to that kind of construction in the area. LS

TITLE: Against the Destruction of Public Space in Zagreb
GOALDESC: "against usurpation of public space in the center of Zagreb... a pedestrian zone — in order to build a ramp for the underground garage of a private ‘lifestyle centre’" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/15/croatia-police-breaks-up-peaceful-protest-in-zagreb/
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Civic associations Right to the City" http://pravonagrad.org/kontakt/ FORMAL "and Green Action" - http://zelena-akcija.hr/hr/kontakt
PARTOFF: " thousands of citizens who would show up at numerous protests, and cultural events organized in the reclaimed public space." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/15/croatia-police-breaks-up-peaceful-protest-in-zagreb/
OUTDESC: "The City Council of Zagreb adopted, in its session of Thursday, March 23, 2013, the proposed changes to the General Urban Development Plan supported by the civil society activists that delete and annul the provisions that allowed for the destruction of Zagreb's Cvjetni Trg (Flower market Square) and the usurpation of pedestrian area in Varšavska Street." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/15/croatia-police-breaks-up-peaceful-protest-in-zagreb/
NARR: Against the Destruction of Public Space in Zagreb is a environmental justice campaign aiming to prevent the city council from destroying pedestrian areas in Zagreb with the initiator(s), the civic associations Right to the City and Green Action, based in Croatia and the target(s), Zagreb city council based in Croatia. Digital activity consisted of blog and video and Twitter. Offline activity consisted of several rallies and protests and cultural events in Zagreb Croatia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a coalition of two civic associations which got much support from the general public in their online and offline protests. As of June 25, 2013 the campaign is completely successful since the Zagreb city council adopted the changes that the civic associations proposed. DS

TITLE: Against Monsanto's "Deadly Gift" to Haiti
GOALDESC: "against the “donation” " of Monsanto seeds to Haiti - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/05/haiti-saying-no-to-monsanto/
INITDESC: FORMAL or INFORMAL (no additional info given) "Peasant Movement of Papaye (MPP) and... the National Peasant Movement of the Congress of Papaye (MPNKP)" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/05/haiti-saying-no-to-monsanto/
PARTOFF: "I'm hearing 10 thousand people at Haiti's anti Monsanto demonstration"  "Haitian farmers, for that matter – who, at the beginning of June, staged a protest against the “donation” and burned more than 400 tons of Monsanto's hybrid corn and vegetable seeds" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/05/haiti-saying-no-to-monsanto/
OUTDESC:
The seed was still distributed "all 60 MT were distributed, with the most going to three plains where WINNER works: Cul de Sac, Cabaret/Archahaie and near Gonaives.
Because the corn was delivered late in the season, very little had been planted by the time of the report (August 6)" - http://www.truth-out.org/news/item/917:monsanto-in-haiti
NARR: Against Monsanto's "Deadly Gift" to Haiti is an environmental campaign aiming to keep Monsanto from distributing seed in Haiti, initiated by Haitian bloggers and others from unnamed countries. Digital activity consisted of blogging. Offline activity consisted of a protest burning seed in Haiti. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a network of bloggers. As of June 26, 2013, the campaign is unsuccessful because the seed was distributed. RM

TITLE: Against Auchan Shopping Mall Expansion
GOALDESC: "Either [Auchan] cooperates with environmental protection and so it can keep its profit, or, if it does not cooperate, then it would reach its own goal against itself, being chased away from this country. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/29/hungary-citizens-protest-against-auchan/
INITDESC: INDIV "the “marsh defenders”" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/29/hungary-citizens-protest-against-auchan/
PARTOFF: no numbers "calls citizens to boycott the shopping mall" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/29/hungary-citizens-protest-against-auchan/
OUTDESC: A website for the proposed shopping mall is now online, indicating that it was built.  http://dunakeszi.auchan.hu/#p0
NARR: Against Auchan Shopping Mall Expansion is an environmental campaign aiming to stop the expansion of a shopping mall in an area of nature interest. The initiator is an environmental website and bloggers. The target is Auchan “International” (France) in order to pressure Auchan Hungary. The online participation is mainly through three Facebook pages and the blogs. There’s not information regarding offline activities.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as an amateur environmental website following techniques of online activism that learned from a recent Greenpeace campaign. As up to June 28, 2013 there is not information regarding whether or not the expansion was made or not. LS

TITLE: Against the Silence Decree
GOALDESC: "[against silence decrees like] a notarial decree constrained the opening hours of the popular ‘ruined pub’ Szimpla Kert" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/16/hungary-another-silence-decree-blows-a-gasket/
INITDESC: INDIV "people" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/16/hungary-another-silence-decree-blows-a-gasket/, INFORMAL "Bloggers of Kett?s Mérce" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/16/hungary-another-silence-decree-blows-a-gasket/
TARGDESC: "the office where the notary who released the decree worked" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/16/hungary-another-silence-decree-blows-a-gasket/
PARTOFF: "Bloggers of Kett?s Mérce organized a “noisy rally’ [HUN] in front of the office where the notary who released the decree worked" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/16/hungary-another-silence-decree-blows-a-gasket/
OUTDESC: ""The silence decree in force in the Seventh District is to be modified as the Budapest government office has found it to be unlawful. Under the new regulations catering units may keep unlimited hours in the areas where many bars are concentrated, the local council announced on Tuesday." - http://www.xpatloop.com/news/67580
NARR: Against the Silence Decree is a entertainment and fandom campaign aiming to repeal the restriction on noise levels for a particular bar with the initiator(s), Budapest residents, based in HUN and the target(s), the Budapest mayor based in HUN. Digital activity consisted of use of Facebook, glob, and video. Offline activity consisted of rallies in front of the mayor's office. The structure of the campaign can best be described as pretty amateurly organized, an unorganized group of Budapest residents; nothing formal or informal beyond a facebook event. As of June 25, 2013 the campaign is completely successful since the noise restriction has been repealed. DS

TITLE: SOS Internet Indonesia
GOALDESC: " save the internet from “repressive” regulations crafted by the Ministry of Communication and Information (Depkominfo)." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/17/sos-internet-indonesia/
INITDESC: "ndonesian internet users"  - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/17/sos-internet-indonesia/
OUTDESC: "Following the statement, on Friday Minister of Communication and IT Tifatul Sembiring told the press that he intends to revize articles which clearly against civil liberties. However, he won't drop the highly critized regulation draft." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/17/sos-internet-indonesia/
NARR: SOS Internet Indonesia is an information and expression campaign aiming to reject the imposition of repressive controls over the internet in Indonesia. The initiator are Indonesian citizen in Indonesia, the target is the Indonesian government. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook page and twitts.  There is no information regarding the offline activity (besides email petitions). The structure of the campaign can best be described as online crowd. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign has not achieved its goals because the circulation of two celebrity sex videos on the Internet sparked a government clampdown on  pornographic Web content in the summer of 2010, despite opposition from the public. LS

TITLE: Defending Sony (the Man) from Sony (the Firm)
GOALDESC: "[against a] law suit is filed by SONY Corporation ... [claiming] that Sony Arianto Kurniawan’s website – www.sony-ak.com, is a breach of copyright" - http://maverick.co.id/social-media/2010/03/sony-ak-the-case-of-corporates-arrogance/
INITDESC: INDIV "Indonesian onliners – Twitterers, Kaskusers, bloggers" - http://maverick.co.id/social-media/2010/03/sony-ak-the-case-of-corporates-arrogance/
OUTDESC: "Sony Corp. has since then dropped the charge and has already apologized to the blogger' - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/02/indonesia-sony-versus-sony/
NARR: Defending Sony (the Man) from Sony (the Firm) is an information and expression campaign aimed at forcing Sony Corp. to drop a lawsuit against an Indonesian man, with the initiators, Indonesian "netizens," based in Indonesia, and the target, Sony Corp., based in Japan. Digital activity consisted of 45 Facebook group members and forum posts. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots effort organized within the Indonesian online community. As of July 6, 2013, the campaign has been completely successful, since Sony Corp. dropped the lawsuit and apologized. JL

TITLE: Against Reduced Choice for National Institutes of Technology Students
GOALDESC: "[for] a change in the rules so that deserving students get NITs of their choice" - http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-07-11/india/28298289_1_nits-central-counselling-board-popular-branches
INITDESC: INDIV "students from all over the country" - http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-07-11/india/28298289_1_nits-central-counselling-board-popular-branches
OUTDESC: No information about action taken to address demands - http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-07-11/india/28298289_1_nits-central-counselling-board-popular-branches
NARR: Against Reduced Choice for National Institutes of Technology Students is a education campaign aiming to take back a policy that limit the number of choices to pursue higher education. The initiator are students from all over india. The target is the governmental office in charge of the application process India Engineering Entrance Examination (AIEEE). Digital activity consisted of websites initiated to create awareness about the problem and to orientate students in how to wright emails to the institution. There is not information about the offline activities.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as a crowd loosely coordinated. Up to June 27, 2013 there’s is not information regarding the achievement of the campaign’ golas.  LS

TITLE: Free Hamed Saber
GOALDESC: "for the release of Hamed Saber" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/27/iran-campaign-to-free-jailed-photo-blogger-hamed-saber/
INITDESC: INDIV "More than 70 Iranian university graduates and academics" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/27/iran-campaign-to-free-jailed-photo-blogger-hamed-saber/
OUTDESC: "Hamed Saber has been temporarily released from prison on bail" - http://en.irangreenvoice.com/article/2010/aug/09/2250
NARR: Free Hamed Saber is a democracy and rule of law campaign aiming to get Hamed Saber released from prison with the initiator(s), Iranian university students and academics, based in Iran and the target(s), the Iranian government based. Digital activity consisted of use of blogs. No offline activity indicated. The structure of the campaign can best be described as very amateur, the only real indication of activity being the (apparently) minor use of blogs. As of July 1, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since he was released from prison, but only on bail and only temporaryily. DS

TITLE: Against Sales Tax Increases in Iran
GOALDESC: "[against] planned tax increases [in Iran]" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/19/iran-bazaars-closed-for-business-as-merchant-strikes-continue/
INITDESC: INDIV "merchants [in Tehran]" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/19/iran-bazaars-closed-for-business-as-merchant-strikes-continue/
PARTOFF: "Merchant strikes in the main bazaar of Tehran have entered a second week ... Shops have also begun to shut their doors in other major cities, like Tabriz and Isfahan" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/19/iran-bazaars-closed-for-business-as-merchant-strikes-continue/
OUTDESC: "A deal to raise taxes by 15% ended the strike, but hard feelings toward tax collectors continued" - http://articles.latimes.com/2010/jul/18/world/la-fg-iran-economy-20100718
NARR: Against Sales Tax Increases in Iran is a economic justice campaign aiming to reduce the percentage of money merchants have to pay in income tax with the initiator(s), Iranian merchants, based in Iran and the target(s), the Iranian government. Digital activity consisted of teh use of blogs and video. Offline activity consisted of strikes in Iran. The structure of the campaign can best be described as somewhat loose since there was no organizational structure, but it also took some work to coordinate the merchants to strike at once, so some organization is certainly present. As of July 1, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since the percent was reduced from 70% to 15%, but that is still above the expect 7%. DS

TITLE: Overturn the Conviction of Sakineh Mohammadi Ashtiani
GOALDESC: " An international campaign to overturn her sentence" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakineh_Mohammadi_Ashtiani
INITDESC: "Farideh and Sajjad Qaderzadeh" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakineh_Mohammadi_Ashtiani
EPET: "A petition was created in support of her release, and has been signed by several additional prominent activists"
SOCNET: "The letter brought widespread attention in 2010 as a result of grassroots campaigning through social networking sites that led to the letter's being passed along to mainstream mass media" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakineh_Mohammadi_Ashtiani#International_campaign
PARTOFF: "During July 2010, protests occurred in Rome, London and Washington, D.C., among other cities" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakineh_Mohammadi_Ashtiani#International_campaign
OUTDESC: "As a result, her execution has been stayed indefinitely"..."On 24 July 2012, Amnesty International stressed that Sakineh Mohammadi Ashtiani’s fate is still unclear" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sakineh_Mohammadi_Ashtiani
NARR: Overturn the Conviction of Sakineh Mohammadi Ashtiani is a democracy and rule of law campaign aiming to reverse the prison sentence of this woman with the initiator(s), the prisoner's two children, based in IRN and the target(s), IRN authorities. Digital activity consisted of use of an online petition. Offline activity consisted of protests in various cities across the world. The structure of the campaign can best be described as loose, but very broad and amplified; everyday people have been participating, but so how prominent world leaders. As of July 2, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since so much attention has been brought to the case, but she is still in prison and the outcome is still uncertain. DS

TITLE: Against Conditions at Evin Prison
GOALDESC: "protest deteriorating conditions at Tehran's notorious Evin Prison" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/08/iran-political-prisoners-on-hunger-strike/
INITDESC: "Seventeen political prisoners " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/08/iran-political-prisoners-on-hunger-strike/
BLOG: http://persian2english.com/?p=13237, http://balatarinsight.wordpress.com/2010/08/04/%D8%A2%D9%8A%D8%A7-%D8%B5%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%89-%D8%B2%D9%86%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%B3%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%B3%D9%89-%D8%A7%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%B6%D8%B9%D9%8A%D9%81-%D8%B4%D8%AF%D9%87/, http://23khordaad.blogspot.com/2010/08/blog-post_06.html, "Arash Ashouri, a leading Iranian photo blogger based in Iran, writes in his blog, Kosoof, about one of hunger strikers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/08/iran-political-prisoners-on-hunger-strike/
OUTDESC: "We are hopeful that the Tehran prosecutor and other officials at the judiciary keep their promise of meeting our five demands. " - http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/08/10/iranian-prisoners-explain-end-of-hunger-strikes/?_r=0
NARR: Against Conditions at Evin Prison is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at improving the conditions in Evin Prison, with the initiators, 17 political prisoners, based in Iran, and the target, the Iranian regime, also based in Iran. Digital activity consisted of blog posts. Offline activity consisted of a hunger strike by 17 political prisoners. The structure of the campaign is a small group of united activists and their supporters. As of July 6, 2013, the campaign has not achieved any success at all, since there is no indication of a response or action by the Iranian government. JL

TITLE: 1BillionHungry Campaign
GOALDESC: "put pressure on politicians to combat hunger" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/09/brazil-yellow-whistles-warn-about-global-hunger/
INITDESC: "Sponsored by the Food and Agriculture Organization, FAO" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/09/brazil-yellow-whistles-warn-about-global-hunger/
BLOG: http://alinemenezes.com/hungry, http://connectbrazil.blogspot.com/2010/05/fome-mundial-um-marco-sombrio.html, http://zelmar.blogspot.com/2010/07/seguranca-alimentar-e-o-grande-desafio.html, http://fmdelacuadra.blogspot.com/2010/07/seguranca-alimentar-e-o-grande-desafio.html, "a fisherman blog, discusses some data on poverty and presents his opinion on the hunger matters in Brazil" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/09/brazil-yellow-whistles-warn-about-global-hunger/, http://www.earthlingorgeous.com/2010/06/5-20-less-hungry-children.html, http://povertynewsblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/1-billion-hungry-only-tells-part-of.html
OUTDESC: "Depending on the results of this campaign" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/09/brazil-yellow-whistles-warn-about-global-hunger/
NARR: 1BillionHungry Campaign is a health campaign aimed at pressuring politicians to do something about hunger, with the initiator, Food and Agriculture Organization, based in Italy and the targets, politicians, based in Brazil. Digital activity consisted of websites, blogs, and videos. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign is a formal campaign put together by a well-established international organization. As of July 2, 2013, it is unclear whether the campaign has succeeded or failed, as there is no indication of a response or action taken. JL

TITLE: Abolish the Kisha Club System
GOALDESC: "the flow of information has so far been controlled by the mainstream media through a system called ‘the kisha club’" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/04/japan-tech-savvy-freelancers-break-down-the-monopoly-in-information/
INITDESC: "the free-lance journalists" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/04/japan-tech-savvy-freelancers-break-down-the-monopoly-in-information/
OUTDESC: "Institutions with a kisha club limit their press conferences to the journalists of that club, and membership rules for kisha clubs are restrictive. This limits access by domestic magazines and the foreign media, as well as freelance reporters, to the press conferences." - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kisha_club
NARR: Abolish the Kisha Club System is an information and expression campaign aiming to stop with the control over public information from the mainstream media organization of journalist called Krisha club in Japan.  The initiators are free-lance journalists that wanted to have access to public official press-conferences organized by the Club in Japan. The target are mainly public officials to open those  spaces for bloggers and independent journalists. Digital activity consisted of blog-posts prepared by independent journalists. There is not information of the offline activity of the campaign –beside the participation of journalists in the press conferences-. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a professional loose network.  As of  June 25, 2013 the campaign has partially achieved its goals, because although the Kisha system has not been abolished, some elected officials have opened press conferences to the access of no-Krisha journalist. LS

TITLE: Against Buyout of Korea Exchange Bank
GOALDESC: "to defend the flourishing bank against a debt-ridden buyout by Hana.", "against foreign finance's encroachment on South Korean financial turf." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/south-korea-battling-against-foreign-finances-encroachment/
INITDESC: INDIV "Korea Exchange Bank (KEB) employees and civil rights activists went out to the street of capital Seoul together on February 28, 2011, to protest " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/south-korea-battling-against-foreign-finances-encroachment/
TARGDESC: " South Korea's Hana financial group sealed a bid for United States buyout firm Lone Star Funds to takeover KEB in February 2011, but public dissent against the move has continuously escalated. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/south-korea-battling-against-foreign-finances-encroachment/
FORUM: "protest has been amplified by Twitter, Daum Agora (South Korea's most visited public forum) and a few online new media sites." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/south-korea-battling-against-foreign-finances-encroachment/
PARTOFF: "Several thousand people participated in the Seoul protest event ", "About 5,500 people gathered on February 28 (to protest)." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/south-korea-battling-against-foreign-finances-encroachment/
OUTDESC: " Lone Star agreed this month to sell its majority stake to Hana Financial Group Inc. (086790) for $3.4 billion, an almost 50 percent discount to HSBC (HSBA) Holdings Plc’s offer in 2007, according to data compiled by Bloomberg." - http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-12-18/lone-star-3-billion-costs-for-korea-bank-shows-foreigner-perils-real-m-a.html
NARR: Against Buyout of Korea Exchange Bank is an economic justice campaign aiming to prevent the sale of Korea Exchange Bank to an American firm. It was initiated by KEB employees who targeted KEB's owner, Hana Financial Group, asking them not to complete the sale. Digital activity consisted of citizen journalism coverage of the controversy, which was not covered by mainstream news, via Twitter, forums, photo, and video. The structure of the campaign can best be described as KEB employees starting the campaign, with concern citizens supporting them through media-making. As of July 2, 2013, the campaign is a partial success. KEB was sold to the US firm, but then sold back to Hana. MJ

TITLE: Against Cattle Slaughter During Foot-and-Mouth Outbreak
GOALDESC: "against a decision by the South Korean government to cull pigs and cows at risk of contracting foot-and-mouth disease as a preventive measure" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/01/03/south-korea-pleas-against-cattle-killing-in-foot-and-mouth-outbreak/
INITDESC: FORMAL "CARE(Coexistence of Animal Rights on Earth)" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/01/03/south-korea-pleas-against-cattle-killing-in-foot-and-mouth-outbreak/
OUTDESC: "until a more humane way to cull the infected swine is found, the government will have to resort to burying the infected animals alive because the "government has temporarily run out of euthanasia drugs."" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea_foot-and-mouth_outbreak
NARR: Against Cattle Slaughter During Foot-and-Mouth Outbreak is a enviornmental justice campaign aiming to stop the mass killing of pigs and cows with the initiator(s), a young farmer boy and CARE, based in KOR and the target(s), the Korean government. Digital activity consisted of use of blogs, and EPET, and a forum. Offline activity consisted of a demonstration in Korea. The structure of the campaign can best be described as unclear organization, though there seems to be some structure as a result of CARE,a formal org, becoming involved. As of June 19, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since there was a government response but it did not cave to the animal rights activists' demands . DS

TITLE: Against the e-Transacitions Law
GOALDESC: "The ESSA (Electronic Signatures and Services Authority) was established under this law with discretionary, selective, subjective and very broad and unjustified powers, beyond the objectives of the law and its functions. Its prerogatives are almost repressive for all “service providers” of electronic services and economic sectors at large." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/18/lebanon-e-transactions-draft-law-postponed/
INITDESC: "Lebanese online community " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/18/lebanon-e-transactions-draft-law-postponed/
OUTDESC: "The effort eventually paid off, with a decision to delay the vote." - http://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/04/world/middleeast/04iht-m04m1leblog.html
NARR: Against the e-Transacitions Law is a freedom of information campaign aiming to stop passage of a Lebanese Internet freedom law initiated by the leader of a Lebanese computing organization. Digital activity consisted of blog posts and tweets. There was no offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as loosely structured. As of June 26, 2013, the campaign is partially successful because the protestors succeeded in delaying a vote on the law. RM

TITLE: Against Mining Project on Huicholes' Sacred Site
GOALDESC: "[against] a Canadian mining project that is threatening one of [the Huicholes people's] sacred sites" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/26/mexico-indigenous-people-denounce-mining-project-on-sacred-site/
INITDESC: FORMAL "The Indigenous Huicholes ... People" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/26/mexico-indigenous-people-denounce-mining-project-on-sacred-site/
BLOG: "blogger BJM writes on the Indigenous Environmental Network blog Red Road Cancun" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/26/mexico-indigenous-people-denounce-mining-project-on-sacred-site/, http://theesperanzaproject.org/2010/12/from-sierra-to-sea-huicholes-make-their-mark-in-cancun/, http://intercontinentalcry.org/indigenous-wixarika-people-demand-a-moratorium-on-mining/
PARTOFF: "[The Huicholes People] attended the United Nations Climate Change Conference- COP16 in Cancun in order to express their concerns about the Canadian mining concessions" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/26/mexico-indigenous-people-denounce-mining-project-on-sacred-site/
OUTDESC: "However, these 45.000 hectares do not touch any of the existing concessions, particularly the projects of Canadian companies First Majestic Silver Corp. (Project Real de Catorce /Luz) and Revolution Resources Corp (Project Universe). These projects are continuing unaffected, as they themselves have announced." - http://theesperanzaproject.org/2012/08/protection-of-wirikuta-a-cover-for-more-exploitation-wixarika-leaders/
NARR: Against Mining Project on Huicholes' Sacred Site is a rights of ethnic minorities and immigrants campaign aimed at stopping a Canadian mining project, with the initiators, the Wixarika People, based in Mexico, and the target, Canadian First Majestic Silver, based in Canada. Digital activity consisted of blog posts. Offline activity consisted of a delegation with an unspecified number of people being sent to COP16. The structure of the campaign is an effort spearheaded by a particular ethnic group. As of July 2, 2013, the campaign has been partially successful, as the Mexican government designated a national reserve but allowed existing mining projects to remain. JL

TITLE: Against Skopje 2014 Plan
GOALDESC: "comment, criticize, ridicule, and, to a smaller extent, praise the future look of Skopje in 2014... most of the reactions express disagreement for aesthetic reasons and/or due to the huge costs of the project" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/06/macedonia-online-rebellion-against-skopje-2014-plan/
INITDESC: "Citizens" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/06/macedonia-online-rebellion-against-skopje-2014-plan/
VIDEO: "Citizens use social networks, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube to comment, criticize, ridicule, and, to a smaller extent, praise the future look of Skopje in 2014." -http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/06/macedonia-online-rebellion-against-skopje-2014-plan/
OUTDESC: "Almost 20 new buildings -- and a similar number of statues, fountains and monuments -- are being built around the center of Skopje." - http://www.cnn.com/2011/10/04/world/europe/macedonia-skopje-2014
NARR: Against Skopje 2014 Plan is a government accountability campaign by an NGO and bloggers aiming to convince the government to change their plan for a total renovation of the center of the capital. Digital activity consisted of bloggers and tweeps criticizing the plan. Offline activity consisted of an protest rally in Skopje that 1,745 people RSVPed for. The structure of the campaign can best be described as online criticism of the plan following by a formal organization deciding the take action offline. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign is not a success.  The government plan went ahead. MJ

TITLE: Against Roma Discrimination
GOALDESC:
"Many Roma remained without the personal documentation needed to access education, health, employment and social protection." - http://www.amnesty.org/en/region/macedonia/report-2012
" market inspectors and special police forces in full riot gear raided a textile market in the Skopje municipality of Šuto Orizari, aka Šutka, inhabited predominantly by ethnic Roma" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/05/07/macedonia-police-raid-roma-riot/
INITDESC: "blogger" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/05/07/macedonia-police-raid-roma-riot/
BLOG: "Dozens of bloggers commented on this post, including Barabbas" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/05/07/macedonia-police-raid-roma-riot/, "filipko, who responded to the actual question" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/05/07/macedonia-police-raid-roma-riot/, http://www.utrinski.com.mk/default.asp?ItemID=D5E1545B0F7C5C41957EA48B7E9551C1
OUTDESC: "In July, Macedonia assumed the Presidency of the Decade of Roma Inclusion, but failed to commit adequate resources for the implementation of its own action plans or the National Strategy for the Advancement of Romani Women." - http://www.amnesty.org/en/region/macedonia/report-2012
NARR: Against Roma Discrimination is a rights of ethnic minorities and immigrants campaign aimed at ending discrimination of Roma in Macedonia, with the initiators, ethnic Roma and Roma activists, based in Macedonia, and the target, the Macedonian government, also based in Macedonia. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook event, blogs, and video. Offline activity consisted of a protest turned riot and a march with 265 Facebook attendees and reports of "hundreds" of participants. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots effort with unorganized masses of protestors as well as individual activists using social media. As of July 7, 2013, the campaign has not achieved any success at all, since there is no indication of a response or action taken regarding the discrimination of Roma. JL

TITLE: Against the Law on Personal Data Protection
GOALDESC: "criticize recent controversial initiatives by the Macedonian Government to increase its legal powers of surveillance. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/03/macedonia-legislative-changes-raise-privacy-concerns/
INITDESC: "Human rights activists and Internet users " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/03/macedonia-legislative-changes-raise-privacy-concerns/
NARR: Against the Law on Personal Data Protection is a information and expression campaign aiming to protest the increased legal powers of government surveillance with the initiator(s), the Metamorphisis Foundation, based in MKD and the target(s), the MKD government. Digital activity consisted of the use of a forum, blogs, and a website. Offline activity consisted of inviting players to a public round table in MKD. The structure of the campaign can best be described as somewhat amateur in nature as there were random participants, though a formal organization was involved which added some coherence to it; seems to be pretty loose in nature. As of July 1, 2013 the campaign is partially successful since, though it is unclear if any progress took place on the legal side, there is a scheduled meetin where these issues will be discussed. DS

TITLE: Against Price Increases in Mozambique
GOALDESC: "[against the] increase in energy, water, mini-bus taxi and bread prices" - http://www.mg.co.za/article/2010-09-07-mozambique-unrest-shows-power-of-the-sms
INITDESC: INDIV "anonymous SMS message" - http://www.mg.co.za/article/2010-09-07-mozambique-unrest-shows-power-of-the-sms
TARGDESC: "President Armando Guebuza and ruling party Frelimo" - http://www.mg.co.za/article/2010-09-07-mozambique-unrest-shows-power-of-the-sms
PARTOFF: "three days of violence which left 13 dead and about 400 wounded as police clashed with Maputo residents protesting sharp increases in the cost of living" - http://www.mg.co.za/article/2010-09-07-mozambique-unrest-shows-power-of-the-sms
OUTDESC: "Mozambique says it will reverse the increase in the price of bread that sparked deadly riots last week. ... The announcement of the change in policy came from the planning minister, Aiuba Cuereneia, who also said the country would restore some subsidies for electricity and water" - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-11216009
NARR: Against Price Increases in Mozambique is an economic justice campaign aiming to convince the government to take action to counteract price increases on a number of goods. Digital activity consisted of the use of SMS to organize the protest. Offline activity consisted of a violent protest in Maputo that lasted 3 days. The structure of the campaign can best be described as digital media from an unknown initiator being used to organize an offline protest through the forwarding of an SMS message. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign is a partial success because the government did agree to subsidize the cost of bread. MJ

TITLE: Against Construction of Warisan Merdeka Tower
GOALDESC: "against the construction of the [Warisan Merdeka] tower" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/02/malaysia-no-to-mega-tower/
INITDESC: INDIV "Malaysians" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/02/malaysia-no-to-mega-tower/
OUTDESC: "In response to the criticism, the Prime Minister said that the project is not a waste and will bring more benefits" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warisan_Merdeka
NARR: Against Construction of Warisan Merdeka Tower is an economic-justice campaign aimed at stopping the construction of a tower in Malaysia, with the initiators, Malaysian citizens, based in Malaysia, and the target, the Malaysian prime minister, also based in Malaysia. Digital activity consisted of over 300,000 Facebook likes, a blog, and video. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots effort organized by concerned citizens through social media. As of July 3, 2013, the campaign has achieved partial success, since the prime minister responded but there was no indication of action taken. JL

TITLE: Multi-Demand Youth Campaign in Nigeria
GOALDESC: "[for] an urgent overhaul of the security and intelligence apparatus in our country ... solving this perennial power problem ... President Yar’Adua should resume, resign or be removed ... [and] all [of the Uwais report's] recommendations be passed and implemented before the next elections" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/18/nigeria-enough-is-enough-youth-march-on-the-capital/
INITDESC: FORMAL "Enough is Enough, a diverse coalition of youth, media, and business leaders" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/18/nigeria-enough-is-enough-youth-march-on-the-capital/
PARTOFF: "thousands of Nigerians marched on the capital, Abuja" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/18/nigeria-enough-is-enough-youth-march-on-the-capital/
OUTDESC: No information about action taken to address demands - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/18/nigeria-enough-is-enough-youth-march-on-the-capital/
NARR: Multi-Demand Youth Campaign in Nigeria is a campaign with more than two goals aimed at reforming the Nigerian government's security and intelligence institutions, solving the energy shortfall, demanding the resignation of the president, and reforming the electoral system. The initiator, a group called Enough is Enough, is based in Nigeria, and the targets, Speaker Bankole and President of the Senate Mark, also based in Nigeria. Digital activity consisted of a website, a now-defunct Facebook page, a non-campaign-specific Twitter hashtag, blogs, and video. Offline activity consisted of a march with "thousands" of participants in Abuja. As of July 2, 2013, it is unclear whether the campaign has succeeded or failed, since there is no indication of a response or action. JL

TITLE: Against Auction of "Looted" Benin Mask
GOALDESC: "[against] the sale of the 16th-century ivory mask, once thought to have belonged to an ancient Nigerian king" - http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/sothebys-cancels-sale-of-looted-benin-mask-2171125.html
INITDESC: FORMAL "Nigeria Liberty Forum" - http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/sothebys-cancels-sale-of-looted-benin-mask-2171125.html
EPET: "An online petition was organised by the Nigeria Liberty Forum, which describes itself as a "UK-based Nigerian pro-democracy group"." - http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/sothebys-cancels-sale-of-looted-benin-mask-2171125.html
OUTDESC: ""The Benin ivory mask and other items consigned by the descendants of Lionel Galway which Sotheby's had announced for auction in February 2011 have been withdrawn from sale at the request of the consignors," said a Sotheby's spokesman" - http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/sothebys-cancels-sale-of-looted-benin-mask-2171125.html
NARR: Against Auction of "Looted" Benin Mask is a other campaign aiming to [goaldesc] with the initiator(s), Nigeria Liberty Forum, based in NGA and the target(s), Sotheby's Auction House based in GBR. Digital activity consisted of use of social networking sites and an EPET. No offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a concise campaign started by one formal organization, supported by individuals and the Nigerian governmen. As of July 2, 2013 the campaign is completely succesful since the auction was brought to an end. DS

TITLE: Against Nestle's Use of Unsustainable Palm Oil
GOALDESC: "[against using] palm oil in [Nestle's] best-selling chocolate bars" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
INITDESC: FORMAL "Greenpeace" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
SOCNET: "The concession followed a three-month campaign by the environmental group Greenpeace, which led to Nestlé being attacked on social networking sites such as Facebook" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
VIDEO: "One million people watched Greenpeace's spoof advert for KitKat [on YouTube]" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
PARTOFF: "On 17 March, Greenpeace began a campaign against Nestlé, launching an early morning protest at its UK headquarters in Croydon, Surrey" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html, "On 15 April, Greenpeace disrupted Nestlé's annual general meeting in Lausanne" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
OUTDESC: "The company intended to source 18 per cent of its palm oil from "sustainable sources" this year and 50 per cent by the end of 2011" - http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/green-living/online-protest-drives-nestl-to-environmentally-friendly-palm-oil-1976443.html
NARR: Against Nestle's Use of Unsustainable Palm Oil is an environmental-protection campaign aimed at forcing Nestle to stop using palm oil that is unsustainably produced, with the initator, Greenpeace, based in the Netherlands, and the target, Nestle, based in Switzerland. Digital activity consisted of a targeted Facebook campaign and a viral YouTube video. Offline activity consisted of protests at Nestle's UK headquarters and at Nestle's annual meeting. The structure of the campaign is a professionally organized campaign by a major environmental advocacy group. As of July 9, 2013, the campaign has achieved partial success, since Nestle agreed to audit their palm-oil suppliers but did not agree to immediately cease using unsustainable palm oil. JL

TITLE: For Higher Royalties on Gas Exports
GOALDESC: "[for] an increase in the amount of royalties for the [Cusco] region, and they also want to assure that a part of the production remains in the region available at a reasonable price" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/14/peru-protests-in-la-convencion-over-export-of-gas/
INITDESC: INDIV "local residents" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/14/peru-protests-in-la-convencion-over-export-of-gas/
PARTOFF: "The protests have been concentrated in Quillabamba, the capital of La Convención, and in the area of Echararte, where various gas stations are located. On July 30, 17 people who tried to overtake these facilities were detained" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/08/14/peru-protests-in-la-convencion-over-export-of-gas/
OUTDESC: "“All legal avenues are being used so that very soon, through a process of renegotiation (of the Camisea gas contract),” the royalty issue is resolved and all the reserves from Lot 88 are set aside for the domestic market,” Velasquez said after the Cabinet meeting." - http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=363735&CategoryId=14095
NARR: For Higher Royalties on Gas Exports is an economic-justice campaign aimed at raising export royalties on natural gas and reserving some natural gas for domestic consumption, with the initiators, local Quillabamba residents, based in Peru, and the target, the Peruvian government, also based in Peru. Digital activity consisted of blogs and video. Offline activity consisted of a strike in La Convencion province, 17 people who tried to take over gas facilities, and a protest by the Workers Federation of Cusco with an unspecified number of participants. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots upwelling of concerned citizens in concert with organized labor. As of July 2, 2013, the campaign has achieved complete success, since the government agreed to renegotiate royalties and reserve a portion of the natural gas for local consumption. JL

TITLE: SOS! Repair the Roads of Chimbote
GOALDESC: " the regrettable state of the roads in Chimbote" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/14/peru-cyber-activism-in-chimbote/
INITDESC: "bloggers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/14/peru-cyber-activism-in-chimbote/
BLOG: http://gelensalinas.blogspot.com/2010/05/avancen.html, http://hablacabezadelibro.blogspot.com/2010/05/planton-y-foro-publico-sos-arreglen-las.html, http://katiacruz-comunicacion.blogspot.com/2010/05/3-de-junio-planton-y-foro-publico-sos.html, http://expresartesiempre.blogspot.com/2010/05/presencia-y-voz-para-tods.html, http://italojimenez-agora.blogspot.com/2010/06/sumate-al-cambio-la-web-20-puede_02.html "more people have joined these blogging and Twitter initiatives and the integration has expanded to Facebook"  -http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/06/14/peru-cyber-activism-in-chimbote/
OUTDESC: "that request can be included as agenda item at the next meeting of the full building complex." - http://diariocorreo.pe/ultimas/noticias/4014906/las-pistas-de-chimbote-ya-piden-auxilio
NARR: SOS! Repair the Roads of Chimbote is an infrastructure campaign by a local blogger trying to convince the municipal government to invest in road repair. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook group which served as a campaign page and blog discussion of the campaign. Offline activity consisted of a public forum in the town square.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as a claim enunciated by a blogger which was amplified by other bloggers. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign is a partial success.  It appears that the government did fix the roads, but did a poor job so that they were again in bad condition only three years later.  MJ

TITLE: Multi-Demand Miners' Campaign in Peru
GOALDESC: "The mining community demands the repeal of Urgent Decree N° 012 – 2010, Supreme Decree Nº 019-2009, that the Inambari hydro-electrical project not be constructed and for the removal of the Environmental Minister, Antonio Brack Egg.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/06/peru-ongoing-mining-strike/
INITDESC: FORMAL, "This blockade was part of the National Miner's Strike organized by the Mining Federation of Madre de Dios (FEDEMIN for its initials in Spanish) and the Artisan Miners of Peru (FENAMARPE for its initials in Spanish)", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/06/peru-ongoing-mining-strike/
PARTOFF: "... clashes between the police and miners, who had been blockading [es] the South Panamerican Highway near the community of Chala in the Arequipa region. This blockade was part of the National Miner's Strike organized by the Mining Federation of Madre de Dios (FEDEMIN for its initials in Spanish) and the Artisan Miners of Peru (FENAMARPE for its initials in Spanish)", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/04/06/peru-ongoing-mining-strike/
OUTDESC: "Ministry of Energy and Mines (MEM) measures issued emergency decrees to 012-2010 and 004-2011, prohibiting the dredging, noting that this rule does not extend to machines called gringo raft, raft catillo, caranchera and fireworks. This is indicated by Supreme Decree 016-2011, published last Saturday in the newspaper El Peruano", http://www.actualidadambiental.pe/?p=10106
NARR: Multi-Demand Miners' Campaign in Peru is an environmental-protection campaign aimed at stopping the construction of a hydropower project and forcing the environmental minister to resign, with the initiators, two mining advocacy groups, based in Peru and the target, President Garcia, based in Peru. Digital activity consisted of blog posts and tweets (no campaign hashtag). Offline activity consisted of protests in Arequipa, Peru with 10,000 participants. The structure of the campaign is a cooperative effort between two issue-oriented groups. As of June 26, 2013, the campaign has been partially successful, since the president responded but none of the demands were met. JL

TITLE: Against Education Budget Cuts in the Philippines
GOALDESC: "against reduced government subsidy for State Universities and Colleges (SUCs) and the consequent tuition and other fee increases and commercialization of education" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/29/philippines-student-unrest-over-education-budget-cuts/
INITDESC: INDIV "Filipino students" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/29/philippines-student-unrest-over-education-budget-cuts/
PARTOFF: "thousands of Filipino students held massive protest actions, walkouts, class stoppages, and campus strikes" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/29/philippines-student-unrest-over-education-budget-cuts/, "On November 26, 5,000 student protesters marched in the streets of Manila" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/29/philippines-student-unrest-over-education-budget-cuts/, "On the same day, 400 students of the UP Cebu City campus and a similar number in Davao City, among other provinces, walked out of their classes in protest" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/29/philippines-student-unrest-over-education-budget-cuts/
OUTDESC: "For the second straight year since his ascent into power, President Benigno Aquino III’s administration has consistently cut its investment in state universities and colleges" - http://bayan-natin.blogspot.com/2012/02/education-budget.html
NARR: Against Education Budget Cuts in the Philippines is an education campaign aiming to reform education spending with the initiator(s), students, based in the Philippines  and the target(s), government, based in the Philippines. Digital activity consisted of Twitter. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as amateur and crowd based. As of June 28, 2013 the campaign is over, without success. KS

TITLE: Free the 43
GOALDESC: "for the release of the 43" health workers - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/21/philippines-outrage-over-arrest-of-43-health-workers/
INITDESC: INDIV "Like a Rolling Store reposts a fact sheet on the arrest of the 43. Nobody.Else.Like.Me notes a suggestion for the Morong 43 to file a case using the Anti-Torture Law. Asteroid-B612 calls for the release of the 43" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/21/philippines-outrage-over-arrest-of-43-health-workers/
PARTOFF: image of some kind of offline protest for the detained workers, total number unclear - http://globalvoicesonline.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/health_arrest04-300x219.jpg
OUTDESC: As of July 27, 2013: "Morong 43 is a group of 43 health workers in the Philippines accused to cooperate with New People's Army.[1] They are all Filipino health workers suspected by government of the Philippines that they make destabilizing against government and arrested in Morong, Rizal via illegal possession of firearms and explosives" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morong_43
NARR: Free the 43 is a Democracy and rule of law campaign aiming to free 43 community health workers detained in Morong, Rizal, Philippines accused of being armed communist rebels.  The initiators are individuals (public) in Philippines supported by international human rights organizations. Digital activity consisted of several blog post,  . There is not information regarding offline activity.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose advocacy campaign managed by bloggers. As of June 27, 2013 the campaign has achieved its goals and the charges against the workers were dropped by the government.

TITLE: Against Registry of Banned Websites and Services
GOALDESC: " discuss the government's proposal to introduce the Registry of Banned Websites and Services. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/02/poland-potential-internet-access-restrictions-boosting-creativity/
INITDESC: "Polish bloggers " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/02/poland-potential-internet-access-restrictions-boosting-creativity/
SITE: "a dummy website [PL] featuring the Prime Minister" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/02/poland-potential-internet-access-restrictions-boosting-creativity/
OUTDESC: "Yesterday the Polish government accepted the proposal to create a Registry of Banned Websites and Services." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/01/21/poland-government-approves-proposal-to-create-registry-of-banned-websites-and-services/
NARR: Against Registry of Banned Websites and Services is a information and expression campaign aimed at stopping restrictions being placed on Polish web traffic, with the initiator, Blackout Europe, based in Poland, and the target, the prime minister of Poland, also based in Poland. Digital activity consisted of a website, a blog, and video. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign appears to be spearheaded by a freedom of information advocacy group. As of July 3, 2013, the campaign has achieved complete success, since the proposed registry of banned sites was withdrawn. JL

TITLE: Against New Policies of ISP Paltel
GOALDESC: "the new Paltel ADSL policy has triggered a wave of online demonstrations by internet users in the West Bank and Gaza due to the limitations that are going to be placed on the speed of the internet service." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/04/palestine-dissatisfaction-with-new-adsl-policy-by-paltel/
INITDESC: " internet users" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/04/palestine-dissatisfaction-with-new-adsl-policy-by-paltel/
SOCNET: "On Facebook, many groups have been created by angry Palestinians users who have started a movement objecting to the new Paltel policy." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/04/palestine-dissatisfaction-with-new-adsl-policy-by-paltel/
NARR: Against New Policies of ISP Paltel is a information access campaign aiming to protest Paltel ISP's caps on bandwidth with the initiator(s), Palestinian bloggers, and the target(s), Paltel, an ISP based in Palestine. Digital activity consisted of blogging and creating Facebook groups.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as a very loose group of upset individuals. As of June 26, 2013 the campaign is over, but the outcome is unclear. FE

TITLE: Governor Georgy Boos and Prime Minister Putin: Resign
GOALDESC: 'Famous political leaders, journalists and regular netizens flooded the blogosphere with their takes on the protest" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/02/russia-anti-government-protest-covered-by-bloggers-ignored-by-media/
INITDESC: "Famous political leaders, journalists and regular netizens" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/02/russia-anti-government-protest-covered-by-bloggers-ignored-by-media/
OUTDESC: "Mr. Boos’ name was not on it." - http://www.agoodtreaty.com/2010/08/16/the-old-boss/
NARR: Governor Georgy Boos and Prime Minister Putin: Resign is a democracy campaign aiming to force the resignation of Russian officials Boos and Putin, initiated by Russian bloggers. Digital activity consisted of multiple blog posts. Offline activity consisted of a 10,000 person protest in Kaliningrad, Russia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an informal network. As of 26 June 2013, the campaign is partially achieved because Georgy Boos was not reappointed to office. Putin is still president. RM

TITLE: Health Minister Tomica Milosavljevic: Resign
GOALDESC: "several Serbian bloggers united to demand the resignation of Serbia’s Minister of health, Tomica Milosavljevic, whom many hold responsible for the corrupt state of medical practice in public health institutions"- http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/08/serbia-bloggers-make-health-care-scandal-a-personal-affair/
INITDESC: "Serbia’s bloggers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/08/serbia-bloggers-make-health-care-scandal-a-personal-affair/
TARGDESC: " Serbia’s Minister of health, Tomica Milosavljevic" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/08/serbia-bloggers-make-health-care-scandal-a-personal-affair/
OUTDESC: "Although no resignation has been confirmed, both bloggers and many citizens are hopeful " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/07/07/serbia-blogger-reports-health-ministers-impending-resignation/
NARR: Health Minister Tomica Milosavljevic: Resign is a Health  campaign aiming to ask the resignation of the Health minister in Serbia.  The initiator are independent bloggers from Serbia. The Digital activity consisted mainly of blog-posts. The offline activity consisted in citizen visiting the health office and posting signs supporting the campaign. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a crowd of bloggers initiated by three different individuals.  As of June 28, 2013 there is not information according to whether the campaign achieved its goals. Because the Minister was in office at least for one more year.

TITLE: Against Obligatory Patriotism in Slovakia
GOALDESC: "against [a draft bill by the Slovak National Party (SNS) will introduce “obligatory patriotism” in Slovakia]" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/05/slovakia-unwanted-patriotism/
INITDESC: INDIV "Bloggers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/05/slovakia-unwanted-patriotism/
PARTOFF: "there have been organized protests in front of the presidential palace and the parliament" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/05/slovakia-unwanted-patriotism/
OUTDESC: "After protests and later appeal of leader of the biggest government-coalition party (which originally voted for this law) president did not sign" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/05/slovakia-unwanted-patriotism/
NARR: Against Obligatory Patriotism in Slovakia is a democracy and rule of law campaign aiming to stop the passing of a patriotism law with the initiator(s), netizens, bloggers, and people who protest in the streets, based in Slovakia and the target(s), the Slovakian government based. Digital activity consisted of use of a blog and comments on a news website. Offline activity consisted of protests in front of the presidential palance and parliament in Slovakia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as very loose, with no real organizational structure; only mentions bloggers and random netizens, offline protesters, but no real coherence. As of July 1, 2013 the campaign is completely successful since the president did not pass the law. DS

TITLE: Lift Sanctions on Syrian Air
GOALDESC: "to release the sanctions on Syrian Air" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/07/syria-youth-rally-in-support-of-syrian-air/
INITDESC: INDIV "a group of Syrian youth" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/07/syria-youth-rally-in-support-of-syrian-air/
OUTDESC: "In 2010, Syrian Air turned to Russia to buy planes after plans to buy as many as 50 Airbus aircraft were scuttled because of US sanctions that forbid the sale of aircraft that include US-made parts." - http://www.arabianbusiness.com/exclusive-sanctions-threaten-future-of-syrian-air-467220.html
NARR: Lift Sanctions on Syrian Air is an economic justice campaign aiming to lift the sanctions that US government impose over Syria in order to buy spare parts and aircrafts.  The initiator(s), a group of Syrian youth that believe in their right to flight safety. The target is the USA government. Digital activity consisted of  a website that is not available at this time and a Facebook page with no many members. There is not information regarding the offline participation. The structure of the campaign can be best described as an amateur group of individuals using few platforms. As of 06/27/2013 the campaign has not achieved its goal and the Syrian air decided to buy aircraft parts to Russia, rather than US. LS

TITLE: Arab Spring: Tunisia
GOALDESC: " Tunisian netizens ceased the incident to complain about the lack of jobs, corruption and deteriorating human rights conditions in their country." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/23/tunisia-unemployed-mans-suicide-attempt-sparks-riots/
INITDESC: INDIV "Tunisian netizens ceased the incident to complain " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/23/tunisia-unemployed-mans-suicide-attempt-sparks-riots/
TARGDESC: " Mr President, Tunisians are Setting Themselves on Fire", "The Tunisian government did not find another solution but to censor the websites disseminating the story and imposing a blockade on the city of Sidi Bouzid" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/23/tunisia-unemployed-mans-suicide-attempt-sparks-riots/
PARTOFF: " sparking a wave of riots on the ground and solidarity and support", " imposing a blockade on the city of Sidi Bouzid, where people are expressing their anger by protesting in the streets." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/12/23/tunisia-unemployed-mans-suicide-attempt-sparks-riots/
OUTDESC: "Overthrow of Zine El Abidine Ben Ali; Ben Ali flees into exile in Saudi Arabia" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_Spring
NARR: Arab Spring: Tunisia is a economic justice campaign aiming to address joblessness and corruption in Tunisia, initiated by Tunisian citizens. Digital activity consisted of Twitter, Facebook and blogs. Offline activity consisted of protests in Sidi Bouzid and other cities in Tunisia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as grassroots, quick-growing and effective. As of 1 July 2013, the campaign is partially successful because the Tunisian government was overthrown. RM

TITLE: Free Jailed Tunisian Students
GOALDESC: "a support campaign calling for their freedom" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/01/18/tunisia-bloggers-against-student-imprisonment/
INITDESC: "bloggers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/01/18/tunisia-bloggers-against-student-imprisonment/
NARR: Free Jailed Tunisian Students is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at freeing several Tunisian students for protesting, with the initiators, bloggers, based in Tunisia and the target, the Tunisian dictatorship, also based in Tunisia. Digital activity consisted of 24 Facebook group members and blogs. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign appears to be entirely grassroots, with interested individuals making up the campaign. As of June 25, 2013, the campaign's success is unclear, since there is no indication that the students have been released or that the concerns have been addressed. JL

TITLE: End the Petrochemical Industry in Taiwan
GOALDESC: "the government's decision to build the new Kuokuang petrochemical plant on the biggest wetland of Changhua County" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/, "[against using] TWD 3 million (about USD 100,000) of  taxpayer’s money on the ads to defend private corporations’ interests" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/
INITDESC: INDIV "Wenli Xu, a well-known Nintendo collector and online activist" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/, FORMAL "Environmental Protection Union of Changhua" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/
TARGDESC: "The Industrial Development Bureau (IDB) under Taiwan's Ministry of Economical Affairs" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/
EPET: "30,000 citizens have pledged to join online" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/09/taiwan-without-petrochemical-industry/

NARR: End the Petrochemical Industry in Taiwan is an environmental-protection campaign aimed at shutting down the petrochemical industry in Taiwan, with the initiators, bloggers and online activists, based in Taiwan, and the target, the Industrial Development Bureau, also based in Taiwan. Digital activity consisted of 30,000 petition signatures, 118 Facebook page likes, blogs, and websites. Offline activity consisted of a protest with a thousand protestors at an unspecified petrochemical plant in Taiwan. The structure of the campaign appears to be a grassroots effort by concerned citizens in conjunction with existing environmental groups. As of July 3, 2013, the campaign has not achieved any success, since investments in the petrochemical industry went ahead and there was no indication of a response. JL

TITLE: Against Death Sentence for HIV-Positive Sex
GOALDESC: " drop a bill that would impose the death sentence for the crime of "aggravated homosexuality" - when an HIV-positive person has sex with anyone who is disabled or under the age of 18. " - http://www.irinnews.org/report/88275/uganda-online-protest-keeps-spotlight-on-anti-gay-bill
INITDESC: FORMAL "Edward Ssekandi, on 1 March, AIDS activists - including founder of national NGO, The AIDS Support Organization, Noerine Kaleeba and Canon Gideon Byamugisha, the first religious leader to publicly declare that he was living with HIV" - http://www.irinnews.org/report/88275/uganda-online-protest-keeps-spotlight-on-anti-gay-bill
TARGDESC: "online petition urging Uganda's parliament to drop a bill " - http://www.irinnews.org/report/88275/uganda-online-protest-keeps-spotlight-on-anti-gay-bill
OUTDESC: "In November 2012, Uganda agreed to pass a new law against homosexuality by the end of 2012 as a "Christmas gift" to its advocates, according to the speaker of parliament." - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uganda_Anti-Homosexuality_Bill
NARR: Against Death Sentence for HIV-Positive Sex is an anti-homophobia campaign aiming to stop the implementation of a harsh anti-gay bill in Uganda with the initiator(s), AIDS Support Organization and Canon Byamugisha, a religious leader living with AIDS, based in Uganda and the target(s), the Ugandan Government. Digital activity consisted of over 1.5 million petition signatures. Offline activity consisted of protests, though locations and numbers are unclear. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a broad group of NGOs and concerned citizens. As of June 25, 13 the campaign is ongoingand has been partially successful, while the law has been delayed but not killed. FE

TITLE: Against New Tax Code in Ukraine
GOALDESC: "against the new tax code approved by the Ukrainian Parliament" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/24/ukraine-social-media-play-crucial-role-in-covering-anti-tax-code-protests/
INITDESC: INDIV "Ukrainian entrepreneurs from different regions" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/24/ukraine-social-media-play-crucial-role-in-covering-anti-tax-code-protests/
SOCNET: "A nearly full informational picture of the day has been painted by the social media – Twitter, Facebook" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/24/ukraine-social-media-play-crucial-role-in-covering-anti-tax-code-protests/
PARTOFF: "several thousand Ukrainian entrepreneurs from different regions gathered in the center of Kyiv" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/11/24/ukraine-social-media-play-crucial-role-in-covering-anti-tax-code-protests/
OUTDESC: "Bowing to pressure, the President met protesters in person at Kiev’s Independence Square on November 27, before his decision to veto the November 18 parliamentary decision" - http://www.tax-news.com/news/Ukraine_Agrees_New_Tax_Code____46682.html
NARR: Against New Tax Code in Ukraine is a economic justice campaign aiming to resist the new tax code put forward in the Parliament with the initiator(s), Ukranian entrepeneurers, based in UKR and the target(s), Ukranian Parliament. Digital activity consisted of use of video, blog, Twitter, and Facebook. Offline activity consisted of more protests in Kyiv, UKR. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an informal collection of UKR entrepeneurs that don't seem to be grouped in any real structure, but rather are individuals protesting with a common cause. As of July 1, 2013 the campaign is completely successful since the new tax code was not approved, but rather vetoed by the president. DS

TITLE: For Better Conditions in Georgia Prisons

PARTOFF: "Inmates have refused to leave their cells or perform their jobs, in a demonstration that seems to transcend racial and gang factions that do not often cooperate.", http://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/12/us/12prison.html?emc=eta1&_r=0

NARR: For Better Conditions in Georgia Prisons is a prisoners rights campaign aiming to improve prison conditions and secure pay for prison labor with the initiator(s), prisoners in various state prisons, based in Georgia and the target(s), the Georgia Department of Corrections. Digital activity consisted of coordinating via sms. Offline activity consisted of a prisoners' strike in Georgia prisons. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a well organized group of prisoners supported by key leaders outside the prison. As of June 25, 2013 the campaign is over, having failed to meet its demands. FE

TITLE: Times Israel Bureau Chief Disclosure
GOALDESC: "Citing the NYT's company policy, EI argued that the paper had a responsibility to disclose the information to readers" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/02/09/arab-world-should-the-new-york-times-reassign-ethan-bronner/

NARR: Times Israel Bureau Chief Disclosure is a media bias campaign launched by the news site Electric Intifada aiming to get the New York Times to disclose that the son of their Israel bureau chief had joined the Israeli military. Digital activity consisted of an email to the Times, along with blog and Twitter discussion of the topic. There does not appear to have been any offline activity.  The structure of the campaign can best be described as a news organization stating a demand that was then echoed in social media, particularly blogs.. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign is a success because the Times did disclose (publicly admit) the information. MJ

Digital activity consisted of use of SMS and a website. No offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a professionally organized campaign put on by a sophisticated, seemingly wealthy formal organization that got responses from tens of thousands of people. TITLE: Against Poverty and Violence on the US-Mexico Border

Digital activity consisted of a Facebook page, twits, website, videos. Offline activity consisted of a hunger strike which was the main event “amplified” by online activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a traditional hunger strike protest amplified by online tools. As of July 3, 2013 the campaign has ended 10 days after starting without receiving response from the Obama administration. LS

TITLE: Geico: Fire Actor with Anti-Tea Party Views
GOALDESC: “(They asking GEICO to fire the actor) Feel free to contact (Douglas)...Call his employer too,” read the post. “Let them know that you, in fact, are not a mentally retarded killer, but that you are now in the market for car insurance.”, http://www.thestar.com/business/2010/04/22/voicemail_gets_actor_dropped_from_geico.html

NARR: Geico: Fire Actor with Anti-Tea Party Views is a information and expresion campaign aiming to fire the actor who put his voice for GEICO -insurance company- commercials, after the actor left an inflammatory voice message on the voice-mailbox of an advocacy conservative group 'freedom works' . The initiator is the group ‘Freedomworks” who posted the phone of the actor and the company based in the USA. Digital activity consisted mainly in posting the information of the actotr in the website in order Tea-Party supporters could calle him. The structure of the campaign can best be described as advocacy campaign, lead to a single organization targeting a single company. Up to June 27, 2013 the campaign has achieved its goals. LS
