NARR: For Class Credits for Playing in Jazz Orchestra is a education campaign aimed at giving students who play in the jazz orchestra performance credit, with the initiator, Alyssa Kroes, based in the US and the target, the University of Wisconsin-Madison's School of Music, also based in the US. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook page with at least 200 likes. There was a letter-writing effort with an unspecified number of participants. The structure of the campaign appears to be centered around a single concerned student who used social media to rally other interested students. As of June 26, 2013, the campaign has achieved partial success, as faculty in the School of Music responded to the concerns. JL

TITLE: Against S.B. 1070

Digital activity consisted of over 7,000 tweets, a blog, and video. Offline activity consisted of protests at a Chicago Cubs game with an unspecified number of participants, plans to file lawsuits by mayors of prominent Arizona cities, two lawsuits filed against the law, and a March 21 rally in Washington, D.C., with "thousands" of immigrants. The structure of the campaign is a combination of professional advocacy groups and individual citizens and activists united through social media. TARGDESC: "the congressmen that have the power to get Haiti's government to end child slavery" - http://mashable.com/2010/03/26/ashton-kutcher-demi-moore-campaign-end-child-slavery/
MICBLOG: "Demi and Ashton are encouraging everybody to use Twitter to @reply to the congressmen that will be attending next week's UN meeting " - http://mashable.com/2010/03/26/ashton-kutcher-demi-moore-campaign-end-child-slavery/
OUTDESC: "It is believed that the 2010 Haiti earthquake has caused many more children to become restavecs, as children who were orphaned by the quake could potentially be turned over by distant relatives who cannot care for them" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Restavec#Current_situation
NARR: Ban the "Restavec" System in Haiti is a education and youth campaign aiming to end the restavec system in Haiti, with the initiator(s), the DNA Foundation, based in USA and the target(s), US politicians based in USA. Digital activity consisted of use of Twitter, Facebook, and a website and video. No offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as amateur celebreties throwing together a campaign on multiple platforms, though the website doesn't work and there seem to be holes in the Twitter links as well; some support via Twtiter. As of June 25, 2013 the campaign cannot be described as either successful or not, because the update information is earlier than the first source. DS

TITLE: Against Internet Control in Venezuela
GOALDESC: "applying restrictions will not be a solution for false news over the web" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/23/venezuela-concerns-about-controls-on-the-internet/
INITDESC: "online movements" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/03/23/venezuela-concerns-about-controls-on-the-internet/
OUTDESC: "Access to the Internet in Venezuela continues to be unrestricted" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_in_Venezuela#Internet_censorship
NARR: Against Internet Control in Venezuela is a information and expression campaign aiming to keep the Internet un-censored with the initiator(s), an informal group called Tod@s en red, based in VEN and the target(s), the Venezuelan government. Digital activity consisted of use of blogs, and a website. No offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a group of bloggers having a public conversation about the topic, encouraging the government to follow a certain course of action. As of July 8, 2013 the campaign is completely successful since there is not sign of censorship. DS

TITLE: Recognize Corrective Rape as a Hate Crime
GOALDESC: "In December 2010, a lesbian activist group, Luleki Sizwe, posted a petition on www.change.org, demanding that the South African government recognize corrective rape as a hate crime. ", http://www.refworld.org/publisher,IRIN,,,4d82fb0fc,0.html
INITDESC: "In December 2010, a lesbian activist group, Luleki Sizwe, posted a petition on www.change.org, demanding that the South African government recognize corrective rape as a hate crime. ", http://www.refworld.org/publisher,IRIN,,,4d82fb0fc,0.html
TARGDESC: "In December 2010, a lesbian activist group, Luleki Sizwe, posted a petition on www.change.org, demanding that the South African government recognize corrective rape as a hate crime. ", http://www.refworld.org/publisher,IRIN,,,4d82fb0fc,0.html
PARTOFF: "More than 100 people gathered outside Parliament in support. ", http://www.refworld.org/publisher,IRIN,,,4d82fb0fc,0.html
OUTDESC: "Corrective rape is not recognized by the South African legal system as a hate crime despite the fact that the South African Constitution states that no person shall be discriminated against based on their social status and identity, including sexual orientation", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corrective_rape#South_Africa
NARR: Recognize Corrective Rape as a Hate Crime is a Gender and sexuality campaign aiming to eliminate the practice of rape as a corrective measure of lesbianism.  The initiator is a formal lesbian organization, based in Cape Town, South Africa. The target is the South African government. The Online activity consisted of an online petition with more than 170thousand signatures. Offline activity consisted of a rally of around 100people outside of the parliament. The campaign structure can be best described as an NGO campaign amplified by an online petition. Up to June 27, 2013 the campaign has partially achieved its goals, because they reach an agreement with government; but some sources inform that the policy has not been yet implemented. LS

TITLE: Against Police Brutality at Bangladesh-India Border
GOALDESC: "to discipline BSF" (Indian Border Security Force)" "to stop the killings at the [Indian-Bangladesh] border" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/29/bangladesh-boycotting-indian-products-to-protest-brutality-at-border/
INITDESC: FORMAL "Indian human rights organization Masum" - http://www.masum.org.in/contactus.php http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/29/bangladesh-boycotting-indian-products-to-protest-brutality-at-border/
PARTOFF: A boycott is proposed in the future, no indication if it actually took place or how big it was
OUTDESC: ""Over the last several years, Bangladeshi authorities had been raising the issue of deaths due to BSF firing along the international border. Finally, with the view to improve relations with Bangladesh, the Government of India decided to adopt a non-lethal policy along the border. Jawans were instructed not to open fire unless their lives are threatened. The number of deaths along the international border has come down" - http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-07-04/kolkata/40370334_1_bsf-firing-border-security-force-border-guard-bangladesh
NARR: Against Police Brutality at Bangladesh-India Border is a anti-brutality and ethnic identity campaign aiming to stop Indian Security forces brutality against Bangladeshis with the initiator(s), a group of bloggers and human rights organizations, based in Bangladesh and the target(s), the Indian Government. Digital activity consisted of blog posts and facebook usage. Offline activity consisted of boycotting Indian products and services, though there is no measure of participation. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose network of bloggers and human rights organizations. As of 2013 the campaign is has ended, achieving some degree of online content sharing and the initial video of brutality having received widespread coverage and provoked response from Indian officials. FE [no date given by coder]

TITLE: Against Changes to Forest Act
GOALDESC: "to veto the new Forests Act and end unscrupulous Government aid to oligarchs” - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/06/15/bulgaria-protests-against-forest-act-in-sofia/
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Environmental activists and other people self-organize", "Facebook page “Occupy Bulgaria” (with more than 14,000 members) posted 44 photos from the June 14 protest." - https://www.facebook.com/occupybulgarianstreets/info
TARGDESC: " “Call Bulgaria's president to veto the new Forests Act " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/06/15/bulgaria-protests-against-forest-act-in-sofia/
SOCNET: https://www.facebook.com/events/328219683919287/, "Facebook page ÒOccupy BulgariaÓ (with more than 14,000 members) posted 44 photos from the June 14 protest." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/06/15/bulgaria-protests-against-forest-act-in-sofia/, https://www.facebook.com/events/332292873513938/
PARTOFF: "Around 5,000 people (2,000 on the first day and 3,000 on the second) took part in the protests."
OUTDESC: "The controversial amendments of BulgariaÕs Forest Act, which were adopted by the Bulgarian Parliament in June, have been dropped from the final version of the legislation after weeks of massive pressure from environmentalists and citizen groups in Bulgaria" - http://wwf.panda.org/?205828/harmful-amendments-dropped-from-bulgaria-forest-act
NARR: Against Changes to Forest Act is an environmental protection campaign aiming to create stronger protections for forests with the initiator(s), environmentalists, based in Bulgaria and the target(s), the Bulgarian government based in Bulgaria. Digital activity consisted of e-petition, Facebook and blogs. Offline activity consisted of marches. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a coalition built around an issue. As of May 7, 2013 the campaign is over, having achieved success since the controversial amendments were dropped. KS

TITLE: Demanding Government Support for the Disabled of Bolivia
GOALDESC: "demanding a yearly subsidy of at least 3,000 Bolivianos (434 US dollars approximately)." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/26/bolivia-disabled-protesters-demand-more-welfare-support/
INITDESC: INDIV "a group of physically disabled people" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/26/bolivia-disabled-protesters-demand-more-welfare-support/
TARGDESC: "the seat of government in capital La Paz" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/26/bolivia-disabled-protesters-demand-more-welfare-support/
PARTOFF: "after the clash a group of 300 disabled people started a vigil" Ð http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/26/bolivia-disabled-protesters-demand-more-welfare-support/
OUTDESC: "The government of President Evo Morales responded by offering a one-time subsidy equivalent to 145 US dollars, which went into effect the day before the caravan arrived in La Paz. This offer was rejected by leaders of the movement of persons with disabilities" Ð http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/26/bolivia-disabled-protesters-demand-more-welfare-support/
NARR: Demanding Government Support for the Disabled of Bolivia is a disabled rights campaign aiming asking the Bolivian government to pay the disabled an annual subsidy.  It was initiated by a group of disabled people without a collective name.  Digital activity consisted of a solidarity Facebook group and digital coverage of offline activity by allies of the protesters. Offline activity consisted of a hundred-day march and protest where disabled people clashed with police in the capital. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an extremely committed group of protestors carrying on a long offline campaign, with amplification by allies using digital tools. As of May 7, 2013 the outcome of the campaign is unclear. The president of Bolivia offered them a lower subsidy during the campaign, which they declined. MJ

TITLE: Online Protest Against the Bear Bile Business
GOALDESC: "[against the application for listing of] Gui Zhentang, China's largest bear bile medicine producer ... on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/13/china-protest-against-bear-bile-business/
INITDESC: INDIV "netizens" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/13/china-protest-against-bear-bile-business/
TARGDESC: "Gui Zhentang, China's largest bear bile medicine producer" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/13/china-protest-against-bear-bile-business/
SITE: "NGOs like Animal Asia and End Bear Farm have detailed documentation of such cruel practices on their websites." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/13/china-protest-against-bear-bile-business/
OUTDESC: "Guizhentang last month withdrew its application, saying it needed more time to put together its filing.For ChinaÕs animal welfare advocates, the victory signaled the growing clout of a movement that is frequently derided as bourgeois, frivolous or worse", http://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/22/world/asia/chinese-bear-bile-farming-draws-charges-of-cruelty.html?pagewanted=all
NARR: Online Protest Against the Bear Bile Business is an environmental campaign aiming to curtail the bear bile business in general and prevent the entry of one company, Gui Zhentang, from becoming a member of the national stock exchange.  Both the initiator and the target are based in China.   Digital activity consisted of blogging news about the case and asking people to share their opinions via an online poll. Offline activity consisted of one small protest in one city. The structure of the campaign can best be described as formal NGOs and netizens providing information and netizens mobilizing actions. As of April 5, 2013 the campaign's outcome is unclear.  Their campaign temporarily succeeded in preventing the company from listing on the stock exchange, but the company continue to press for membership. ) MJ

TITLE: Demanding Retraction of Inaccurate Article on Breastfeeding
GOALDESC: "demand a retraction [of a story titled "Young mother nurses 6-month baby into cerebral palsy]" - http://www.danwei.com/breast-feeding-rebels-in-china/
INITDESC: INDIV " Groups of mothers and breastfeeding advocates from Chengdu to Shanghai to Beijing" - http://www.danwei.com/breast-feeding-rebels-in-china/, INFORMAL "The informal leader of a Chengdu mothers group, The Breastfeeding Mothers Union, Xiaowazi helped lead the protest" - http://www.danwei.com/breast-feeding-rebels-in-china/
SOCNET: ""After two days of furious action on the Twitter-like Sina Weibo" - http://www.danwei.com/breast-feeding-rebels-in-china/
OUTDESC: "After two days of furious action on the Twitter-like Sina Weibo and other forums, including posts from officials within the National Ministry of Health, the newspaper redacted the story and published another one with interviews from breastfeeding advocates." - http://www.danwei.com/breast-feeding-rebels-in-china/
NARR: Demanding Retraction of Inaccurate Article on Breastfeeding is a health campaign aiming to increase awareness of breast feeding with the initiator(s), individuals and informal groups, based in China and the target(s), a traditional mindset, based in China. Digital activity consisted of microblogs. Offline activity consisted of parenting groups in China. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a tight campaign to increase awareness. As of May 14, 2013 the campaign succeeded.  The newspaper published another version of the story consonant with the demands of the activists. KS

TITLE: Against BP as Olympic Sponsor
GOALDESC: "against BP's involvement in the London games" - http://www.upi.com/blog/2012/07/06/BP-Olympics-ads-splashed-with-oil/7771341589244/
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Some environmental groups, protesting against BP's involvement in the London games", "The protest site, f-ingthefuture.org, is attempting to mobilize" - http://www.upi.com/blog/2012/07/06/BP-Olympics-ads-splashed-with-oil/7771341589244/
TARGDESC: "Organisers of the Olympics have decided to allow BP" - http://www.upi.com/blog/2012/07/06/BP-Olympics-ads-splashed-with-oil/7771341589244/
PARTOFF: "Some environmental groups, protesting against BP's involvement in the London games, are encouraging acts of "brand piracy"--vandalizing BP's billboards by splashing them with oil-black paint" Ð http://www.upi.com/blog/2012/07/06/BP-Olympics-ads-splashed-with-oil/7771341589244/#ixzz2a0ZJgWSe
OUTDESC: "BP is proud to have been the Official Oil and Gas Partner for the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games" Ð http://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/about-bp/bp-and-london-2012.html
NARR: Against BP as Olympic Sponsor is a economic justice campaign aiming to have BP dropped as an Olympic sponsor with the initiator(s), informal groups, based in Great Britain and the target(s), LOGOC, based in Great Britain. Digital activity consisted of Facebook, blogs, video. Offline activity consisted of blockades, protests and actions. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose coalition of many groups. As of May 7, 2013 the campaign is ended unsuccessfully as BP remained an offical sponsor.  KS

TITLE: Disarm the Gallery
GOALDESC: "[against the] National Gallery regularly [hosting] evening events for arms dealers" - https://www.facebook.com/disarmthegallery/info
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Stop The Arms Fair" - https://www.facebook.com/disarmthegallery/info, FORMAL "Campaign Against Arms Trade" - https://www.facebook.com/disarmthegallery/info
OUTDESC: "The National Gallery's long-standing sponsorship arrangement with weapons manufacturer Finmeccanica has ended, following a campaign by Campaign Against Arms Trade to 'Disarm the Gallery.'" - http://actipedia.org/project/disarm-gallery-protests-end-national-gallerys-arms-trade-links
NARR: Disarm the Gallery  is a campaign against armed conflict aiming to break the National Galleries links with arms dealers. It was initiated by the Campaign Against Arms Trade.  Both parties are located in the UK. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook group with very few members and other social media accounts.  Offline activity consisted of a variety of creative actions at the Gallery, including placing an image of cruise missiles in the Gallery. The campaign was largely offline. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a creative and well-organized offline campaign by a formal organization with minimal use of online tools. The campaign was a success in that it got the Gallery to break ties with an Italian arms manufacturer. MJ

TITLE: We Are All Barillas
GOALDESC: "opposed the construction of a hydroelectric plant. ", "the company be expelled from the community" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/08/guatemala-state-of-siege-due-to-hydroelectric-plant-conflict/
INITDESC: INDIV "Citizens from this community have been using blogs and social networks to report on the current conflict." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/08/guatemala-state-of-siege-due-to-hydroelectric-plant-conflict/
TARGDESC: "citizens expressed their concern and demanded that the company be expelled from the community" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/08/guatemala-state-of-siege-due-to-hydroelectric-plant-conflict/
SOCNET: "they share information through a social network called Barillenses [es], and also use Facebook and Twitter"
OUTDESC: The Guatemalan president didn't really address the issue and the violence is still taking place - http://www.culturalsurvival.org/news/campaign-update-guatemala-sign-petition-free-ruben-herrera
NARR: We Are All Barillas is an indigenous rights, enivronmental, and human rights campaign aiming to protest the construction of a dam and the detention and murder of protestors with the initiator(s), the community of Santa Cruz Barrillas, based in Guatemala and the target(s), the Spanish Company Hidralia Energy, the Guatemalan Government, the Spanish Government, and the US government.. Digital activity consisted of blogging, twitter and facebook usage, and e-petition, and a website. Offline activity consisted of protests in Santa Cruz Barillas. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a mobilization of a tightly knit community through formal and informal political organizations. As of 5/13/13 the campaign is ongoing, having made no apparent successes, while additional community activists appear to have been detained. FE

TITLE: Save KPK
GOALDESC:
"In response to a widely reported conflict between Indonesia's official anti-corruption agency and the police, Indonesian activists have mounted an online campaign to raise awareness and encourage action.

According to the Jakarta Post, the Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission (known by the acronym KPK) launched an investigation into a case of police graft; the police, angered to the point of seeking retribution, have threatened to arrest the KPK commander over a conveniently re-opened 2004 case against him, as a “warning” intended to deter the commission from pursuing other cases involving the country's law enforcement officers." - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign
INITDESC: INDIV " Indonesian activists" - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign
TARGDESC: Target unclear from source 1 - appears to be Indonesian federal police "In response to a widely reported conflict between Indonesia's official anti-corruption agency and the police, Indonesian activists have mounted an online campaign to raise awareness and encourage action." - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign
EPET: "an online petition has received approximately 10,000 signatures." - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign, http://chn.ge/WmX6CL, http://www.change.org/id/petisi/komisi-iii-dpr-perkuatlah-kpk
SOCNET: " the Facebook page Save KPK has received nearly 17,000 "likes," - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign
PARTOFF: "around 1,000 activists demonstrated their support in front of the KPK headquarters" - http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/22966/indonesian-activists-mount-online-anti-corruption-campaign
OUTDESC: "After being rejected a few months ago, a new KPK building budget, which is very much needed finally approved by the House of Representatives Commission III." [translated] - http://www.change.org/id/petisi/komisi-iii-dpr-perkuatlah-kpk
NARR: Save KPK is an Indonesian rule of law campaign aiming to support a government anti-corruption organization, the KPK, from corrupt members of the government seeking to undermine it. It was started by Indonesian activists. Digital activity consisted of a website, Twitter account, Twitter hashtag, e-petition, and active Facebook group. Offline activity consisted of at least one protest. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a group of individual activists starting a long-running campaign to support efforts within the government to fight governmental corruption. Some of the campaign infrastructure seems to have been taken over by the KPK, with the blessing of the organizers, one imagines. As of May 17, 2013 the campaign is ongoing, but two successful e-petition efforts were successful. It is also possible to read Save KPK as an information organizations and the e-petitions and the campaigns of that organization.  It seems that Save KPK started as a campaign to save the KPK from ruin, then morphed into an informal organization to support its strategic needs. [no auther inidicated]

TITLE: Against Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant
GOALDESC:
"The Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP) in the Tirunelveli district of Tamil Nadu, India, started operations recently despite demands to stall it. In recent months the police had cracked down on several protests (see Global Voices report) of activists and inhabitants of nearby villages against this plant.

The ‘People’s Movement Against Nuclear Energy’ (PMANE) activists fear that this nuclear power plant is prone to an accident similar to the radiation leak at the Japanese coastal nuclear plant last year." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/09/14/india-the-koodankulam-nuclear-plant-starts-amidst-protests/
INITDESC: INFORMAL "The People's Movement Against Nuclear Energy"
PARTOFF: "Thousands of villagers protesting at the beach" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/09/14/india-the-koodankulam-nuclear-plant-starts-amidst-protests/,
OUTDESC:
"the Supreme Court has refused to halt the loading of fuel rods in one of the two reactors of the Koodankulam nuclear power plant, but they have agreed to examine the risk associated to the project and consider peoplesÕ safety." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/09/14/india-the-koodankulam-nuclear-plant-starts-amidst-protests/ 
BUT "Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is a nuclear power station in Koodankulam in the Tirunelveli district of the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu"(it still exists) - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kudankulam_Nuclear_Power_Plant
NARR: Against Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is a public health and environmental campaign aiming to shut down a nuclear power plant. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook group to share inititiator news, citizen journalism coverage of offline protests, and a hashtag. Offline activity consisted of several massive protests, including sit-ins (direct action). The structure of the campaign can best be described as a durable informal citizens' group mobilizing offline, with that offline action amplified online.  The government also claims that foreign NGOs are involved. As of May 4, 2013, the campaign is ongoing, though the plant is now operational, making the likelihood of its shut-down more unlikely. MJ

TITLE: Against a Naval Base on Jeju Island
GOALDESC: "Villagers from Gangjeong, South Korea, have been protesting against the construction of a naval base on Jeju Island for several years. As the military project would impact the ecosystem of a UNESCO's World Heritage sites, 94% of Jeju residents have voted against the base in a referendum." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/03/09/south-korea-protest-against-start-of-jeju-naval-base-construction/
INITDESC: FORMAL "National Campaign to End the Korean War explains the situation on March 7 on Facebook:" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/03/09/south-korea-protest-against-start-of-jeju-naval-base-construction/
PARTOFF: "hundreds of activists had arrived on the island to stop the navy from blowing up the coastline further for the construction of the docks." "about 20 activists have entered Gurombee rock, breaking the perimeter fence with stones."- http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/03/09/south-korea-protest-against-start-of-jeju-naval-base-construction/
OUTDESC: "In the midst of warmongering and a worsening of tensions between North and South Korea, a group of peace activists is continuing its non-violent struggle against the construction of a naval base on the island of Jeju, South Korea." http://www.intrepidreport.com/archives/9319#sthash.SrR3TNQ1.dpuf
NARR: Against a Naval Base on Jeju Island is an environmental protection campaign aiming to stop construction of a naval site on Jeju Island with the initiator(s), individuals and informal organizations, based in the US and Korea and the target(s), the Korean government based in Korea. Digital activity consisted of websites, Facebook, and an e-petition. Offline activity consisted of protests. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a formal campaign by a loose coalition of actors. As of May 14, 2013 the campaign is ongoing, without any success. KS

TITLE: Why Free Alaa?
GOALDESC: "Free Blogger Alaa Abd El Fattah", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/11/13/egypt-why-free-blogger-alaa-abd-el-fattah/
INITDESC: INDIV, "On Twitter, supporters have been rallying for his freedom under the hashtag #WhyFreeAlaa",http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/11/13/egypt-why-free-blogger-alaa-abd-el-fattah/
OUTDESC: "On Sunday 25 December 2011, a judge representing the public prosecutor’s office ordered the release of Alaa Abd El-Fattah to take place the following day. He remained under a travel ban", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaa_Abd_El-Fattah
NARR: Why Free Alaa? is a democracy and rule of law campaigned aimed at freeing Alaa Abd El Fattah from prison, with the initiators, supporters of El Fattah, based in unspecified countries and the target, a military-court judge, based in Egypt. Digital activity consisted of 27 tweets. Offline activity consisted of some supportive graffiti. The structure of the campaign seems to be a loose association of online supporters. As of June 24, 2013, the campaigns was a success as a judge order the prisoner released. JL

TITLE: Anderson Cooper: Cover Côte d’Ivoire
GOALDESC: http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/27/cote-d%E2%80%99ivoire-twitter-campaign-for-anderson-cooper%E2%80%99s-attention/
INITDESC: INDIV, "@annagueye: @kenyanpundit yes but people there speak English. I have decided that I will harass @andersoncooper until he gets his ass in #CIV2010", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/27/cote-d%E2%80%99ivoire-twitter-campaign-for-anderson-cooper%E2%80%99s-attention/
TARGDESC: "@annagueye: @kenyanpundit yes but people there speak English. I have decided that I will harass @andersoncooper until he gets his ass in #CIV2010", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/02/27/cote-d%E2%80%99ivoire-twitter-campaign-for-anderson-cooper%E2%80%99s-attention/
OUTDESC: (Anderson Cooper note about Cote d'Ivoire) "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yg_UVoE02mE"
NARR: Anderson Cooper: Cover Côte d’Ivoire is an information campaign aiming to have Anderson Cooper cover the civil war in the Ivory Coast with the initiator(s), individuals, based internationally and the target(s), Anderson COoper, based in the United States. Digital activity consisted of Twitter. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an informal, loose effort. As of June 17, 2013 the campaign is over, with partial success, as Cooper tweeted that the situation deserved more coverage. KS

TITLE: Resign: President José Eduardo dos Santos
GOALDESC: "The objective is for popular action to put an end to the 32 year rule of Eduardo dos Santos.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/angola-reactions-to-call-for-revolution/
INITDESC: INDIV, "the protests are being organized by “Agostinho Jonas Roberto dos Santos” – pseudonym joining the names of personalities from contemporary Angolan history: Agostinho Neto, Jonas Savimbi, Holden Roberto and even President José Eduardo dos Santos himself.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/angola-reactions-to-call-for-revolution/
TARGDESC: "The current President, successor of Agostinho Neto, one of the symbols of the struggle for independence, has been in power since 1979.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/angola-reactions-to-call-for-revolution/
PARTOFF: "Much of the mobilizing for revolution is by word of mouth, and in neighborhood debates, in cities across the country, claims its organizer ", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/05/angola-reactions-to-call-for-revolution/
OUTDESC: "A week after the date of the revolution supposed to “dethrone” Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos and his royal court, the situation in the country appears calm. As if there had never even been a call for revolution.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/03/17/angola-preemptive-maneuver-cancels-revolution/
NARR: Resign: President José Eduardo dos Santos is a pre-democracy campaign by an anonymous individual aiming to convince the President of Angola to step down, along with other demands. Digital activity consisted of a website for the campaign. Offline activity consisted of a rally. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an anonymous individual using a website to start a revolution. As of July 16, 2013 the campaign is not a success.  Protesters where rounded up and their demands were not met. MJ

TITLE: Qom Rights Campaign
GOALDESC: "demanding the restitution of their lands", "to keep the promises signed last November. Those promises … consisted in the construction of housing for the Qom community." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/05/01/argentina-indigenous-protests-in-downtown-buenos-aires/
INITDESC: FORMAL "activists from the Qom community, an indigenous group from the province of Formosa, started a roadblock on the 9 de Julio Avenue in the very center of Buenos Aires." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/05/01/argentina-indigenous-protests-in-downtown-buenos-aires/
TARGDESC: " to reach a dialogue with government officials" , "Qom community activists also lament that the federal government pays so little attention to them" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/05/01/argentina-indigenous-protests-in-downtown-buenos-aires/
PARTOFF: "Since Monday April 25, activists from the Qom community, an indigenous group from the province of Formosa, started a roadblock on the 9 de Julio Avenue in the very center of Buenos Aires.", "Some members of the group, led by Felix Díaz, also started a hunger strike" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/05/01/argentina-indigenous-protests-in-downtown-buenos-aires/
OUTDESC: "The Qom refuse to move from land around the town of Primavera in far northern Argentina where the provincial and national governments want to build a National University of Formosa. A 2006 law is supposed to protect Indian lands, but the Qom have repeatedly faced violent evictions." - http://www.foxnews.com/world/2013/05/22/argentina-qom-indians-ask-president-fernandez-for-help-getting-ancestral-lands/
NARR: Qom Rights Campaign is a democracy campaign aiming to protest police abuses with the initiator(s), individuals, formal and informal organizations, based in Argentina and the target(s), government based in Argentina. Digital activity consisted of blogs.  Offline activity consisted of roadblocks. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a coalition. As of June 20, 2013 the campaign is over, without success at this time. KS

TITLE: Dismiss Governor Suren Khachatryan
GOALDESC: "demands that Surik Khachatrian, governor of Armenia ‘s Syunik province, be immediately sacked for assaulting a woman." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/12/22/armenia-activists-demand-controversial-governors-dismissal/
INITDESC: FORMAL "The Coalition to Stop Violence Against Women" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/12/22/armenia-activists-demand-controversial-governors-dismissal/
OUTDESC: "Syunik region is happy for Surik Khachatryan's dismissal" - http://www.slaq.am/eng/news/46109/
NARR: Dismiss Governor Suren Khachatryan is a democracy and rule of law campaign aiming to ask the dismissal of the Governor of a southern region in Armenia. Digital activity consisted of an online petition and several other informal organization posts in their Facebook pages and two “evidence” videos.  There is no information regarding the offline participation. The structure of the campaign can best be described as organized by a multi-campaign pro-women advocacy organization coalition. As of June 10, 2013 the campaign has achieved its goals getting the governor dismissed, LS

TITLE: Stop Killing Stray Dogs
GOALDESC: "demanding that the inhumane killing of stray dogs end" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/06/28/armenia-animal-activists-demand-end-to-stray-dog-killings/
INITDESC: INDIV "animal activists are making unprecedented use of social media" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/06/28/armenia-animal-activists-demand-end-to-stray-dog-killings/
OUTDESC: "“Mayors change, but the stray animal control projects don’t. They were, are and will keep killing them,” Aramyan says accusingly. " - http://armenianow.com/features/34169/stray_dogs_animals_yerevan_unigraphx
NARR: Stop Killing Stray Dogs is a envrionmental protection campaign aiming to end the killing of stray dogs with the initiator(s), animal rights activists, based in ARM and the target(s), Yerevan mayor Karen Karapetyan based in ARM. Digital activity consisted of useage of a blog and Facebook activity. Signatures were collected (assumed offline b/c EPET not mentioned). The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose group of animal rights activists, along with an informal organization working for animal rights. As of June 19, 2013 the campaign is partially successful, as there has been some response from the local government, though the demands do not appear to have been met. DS

TITLE: Karekin II: Resign
GOALDESC: "[for ousting] the [Armenian] Catholicos [title used for head of church in some Eastern Christian traditions]" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/07/21/armenia-uproar-over-catholicos-remarks/

OUTDESC: "Catholicos Karekin II ... became the head of the Armenian Apostolic Church in 1999" - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karekin_II
NARR: Karekin II: Resign is a religion campaign aiming to fire the religious leaders with the initiator(s), individuals, based in Armenia and the target(s), the leaders, based in Armenia. Digital activity consisted of Facebook and Twitter. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as disorganized. As of June 28, 2013 the campaign is over, without success. KS

TITLE: Against Regulation of Roadside Memorials
GOALDESC: "against the new roadside memorial law ... [requiring] residents wanting a roadside memorial to apply for a permit" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/1900-Albert-Logan-News-.docx
INITDESC: INDIV "Jimboomba resident Donna Powell" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/1900-Albert-Logan-News-.docx
SOCNET: "Jimboomba resident Donna Powell, whose son Dave lost his life in a car accident in 2009, had planned the protest against the new roadside memorial law and was seeking support via her Facebook page for more protesters" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/1900-Albert-Logan-News-.docx
OUTDESC: "Ms Powell said councillors Parker and Clarke had also agreed to waive the two-year period and would allow her to keep the memorial on the corner of Swan Rd and Wynne St at Jimboomba indefinitely" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/1900-Albert-Logan-News-.docx
NARR: Against Regulation of Roadside Memorials is a urban infrastructure campaign aiming to stop a law limiting construction of roadside memorials with the initiator(s), an individual, based in Australia and the target(s), local government based in Australia. Digital activity consisted of Facebook. Offline activity consisted of a petition. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a small, centralized campaign. As of June 17, 2013 the campaign is over, with success, as the law was overturned. KS

TITLE: For Reinstatement of Safe Sex Ads
GOALDESC: "against the removal of the [safe-sex] ads [in Brisbane]" - http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/safe-sex-ads-to-return-to-bus-shelters-20110601-1fg06.html
INITDESC: FORMAL "Healthy Communities" - http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/safe-sex-ads-to-return-to-bus-shelters-20110601-1fg06.html
SOCNET: "More than 30,000 Facebook users joined an online protest" - http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/safe-sex-ads-to-return-to-bus-shelters-20110601-1fg06.html
PARTOFF: "Healthy Communities led a protest against the removal of the ads outside Adshel's Brisbane office on Wednesday, with about 30 people waving the poster." - http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/safe-sex-ads-to-return-to-bus-shelters-20110601-1fg06.html
OUTDESC: ""This has led us to review our decision to remove the campaign and we will therefore reinstate the campaign with immediate effect."" - http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/safe-sex-ads-to-return-to-bus-shelters-20110601-1fg06.html
NARR: For Reinstatement of Safe Sex Ads is a gender and sexuality campaign aiming to reinstate Australian safe sex ads featuring a gay couple. It was initiated by an Australian government group, apparently. Digital activity consisted of a Facebook group and news coverage. Offline activity consisted of a protest in Brisbane, Australia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as small and organization-centered. As of June 24, 2013, the campaign is successful because the advertising company reinstated the ad campaign. RM

TITLE: For a Government in Belgium
GOALDESC: "demand a government for Belgium after seven months of haggling between politicians from the Dutch-speaking north and French-speaking south." - http://www.expatica.com/fr/news/local_news/government-for-belgium-web-protest-gathers-strength_124497.html
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Facebook users" - http://www.expatica.com/fr/news/local_news/government-for-belgium-web-protest-gathers-strength_124497.html
TARGDESC: "politicians from the Dutch-speaking north and French-speaking south." - http://www.expatica.com/fr/news/local_news/government-for-belgium-web-protest-gathers-strength_124497.html
SOCNET: "By Thursday, some 22,000 Facebook users had signed up for the lunchtime march, with a further 25,000 "perhaps" coming too." - http://www.expatica.com/fr/news/local_news/government-for-belgium-web-protest-gathers-strength_124497.html
OUTDESC: "Belgium has sworn in a new government, ending a record-breaking 541 days of political deadlock." - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-16042750
NARR: For a Government in Belgium is a democracy campaign aiming to get a new government with the initiator(s), individuals, based in Belgium and the target(s), politicians based in Belgium. Digital activity consisted of Facebook. Offline activity consisted of a march. The structure of the campaign can best be described as crowd-sourced. As of June 19, 2013 the campaign is over, with total success, as a new government was formed. KS

TITLE: Against ConocoPhilips Gas Deal
GOALDESC: "against the deal highlighting corruption and the fact that the share of Bangladesh government of the explorations will be 20% only." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/06/21/bangladesh-the-energy-politics-and-selling-out-national-interest/
INITDESC: INFORMAL "Activists from the National Committee to Protect Oil, Gas, Mineral Resources, Power and Ports (NCPOGMR) have been campaigning in the country to raise public awareness on this issue" -
TARGDESC: " A democratic government of a civilized country cannot gag people's voice like this." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/06/21/bangladesh-the-energy-politics-and-selling-out-national-interest/
PARTOFF: "Two days before the signing (on June 14, 2011) police brutally cracked down on the members of NCPOGMR who were rallying against the deal" , "The police blockaded the rally near the secretariat, and baton charged the protesters as they approached the barricade." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/06/21/bangladesh-the-energy-politics-and-selling-out-national-interest/
OUTDESC: "US oil giant ConocoPhillips, encouraged by its 2D seismic survey outcome, plans to carry out further exploration deep into the Bay of Bengal, a senior Petrobangla official said." - http://www.thefinancialexpress-bd.com/index.php?ref=MjBfMDVfMTlfMTNfMV8yXzE2OTc4Mg==
NARR: Against ConocoPhilips Gas Deal  is an economic justice campaign aiming to stop an oil deal between the Bangladesh government and Conoco Philips, with the initiator(s), an informal organization, based in Bangladesh and the target(s), the government and oil company, based in Bangladesh and the US, respectively. Digital activity consisted of blogs. Offline activity consisted of protests. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose campaign. As of June 18, 2013 the campaign is over, without success, as the oil company does have rights. KS

TITLE: Demanding Justice in Viqarunnisa Noon School Sexual Assault Case

BLOG:
"some students continued to share their sides of the story via blogs and Facebook." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/07/16/bangladesh-sexual-assault-by-a-teacher-triggers-student-uprising/
http://www.somewhereinblog.net/blog/Masudbestbest/29407871,
PARTOFF: "The events and subsequent student protests caused much uproar in the country and more drama unfolded as the students continued their protest which led to the replacement of the school principal" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/07/16/bangladesh-sexual-assault-by-a-teacher-triggers-student-uprising/, "On 9 July the students of VNC along-with parents and ex-students formed a human chain demanding the resignation of the principal. Bengal Masud posted [bn] videos and pictures of the event. ... Soon the protests gathered more support from other members of the civil society. Also many teachers from VNC joined [bn] in the protests." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/07/16/bangladesh-sexual-assault-by-a-teacher-triggers-student-uprising/
OUTDESC: "A Dhaka court yesterday issued arrest warrants against Husne Ara Begum, former principal of Viqarunnisa Noon School and College and the institution's Bashundhara branch-in-charge Lutfur Rahman in connection with violation of a female student last year" - http://news.priyo.com/national/2012/01/09/arrest-warrant-against-ex-viqa-45199.html
NARR: Demanding Justice in Viqarunnisa Noon School Sexual Assault Case is a gender and sexuality campaign aiming to seek justice for sexual assault with the initiator(s), students, based in Bangladesh and the target(s), the school principal based in Bangladesh. Digital activity consisted of Facebook and blogs. Offline activity consisted of protests. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose protests without formalization. As of June 10, 2013 the campaign is over, with complete success, after the principal was fired. KS

TITLE: Against Sentencing of Medical Professionals in Bahrain
GOALDESC: "[against court sentence of] 5 to 15 years in jail [for] Bahrani medics" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/10/05/bahrain-15-year-jail-sentences-for-medics-who-treated-protesters/

NARR: Against Sentencing of Medical Professionals in Bahrain is a human rights campaign aiming to release jailed doctors with the initiator(s), formal and informal organizations, based in Bahrain and the target(s), the government based in Bahrain. Digital activity consisted of Twitter. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a network of online actors. As of June 24, 2013 the campaign is over, without success. KS

TITLE: Free Emoodz
GOALDESC: "for [Bahraini blogger Mohamed] El-Maskati's release" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/04/05/bahrain-blogger-emoodz-detained/
INITDESC: INDIV "Bahraini residents and friends from around the world" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/04/05/bahrain-blogger-emoodz-detained/

NARR: Free Emoodz is a human rights campaign aiming to release a journalist with the initiator(s), a formal organization, based in Bahrain and the target(s), the government based in Bahrain. Digital activity consisted of microblogs. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a network of Twitter users. As of June 24, 2013 the campaign is over, after the successful release of the prisoner. KS

TITLE: Free Ali Abdulemam
GOALDESC:
"Outrage over the arrest of a Bahraini human rights activist has sparked an outpouring of support from bloggers and human rights advocates around the world.
" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/07/mena-voicing-support-for-bahraini-blogger-ali-abdulemam/
INITDESC: INFORMAL 'Bloggers from across the Arab world and beyond" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2010/09/07/mena-voicing-support-for-bahraini-blogger-ali-abdulemam/
OUTDESC: "ALI #ABDULEMAM IS FREE I AM TALKING TO HIM #BAHRAIN" - https://twitter.com/weddady/status/40188235359596545
NARR: Free Ali Abdulemam is a democracy campaign aiming to free a blogger with the initiator(s), individuals, based in Bahrain and the target(s), government  based in Bahrain. Digital activity consisted of blogs and microblogs. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a loose network of individuals. As of June 14, 2013  the campaign is over, with success, after the blogger was released. KS

TITLE: Arab Spring: Bahrain
GOALDESC: "for political reform and equality for the majority Shia population of Bahrain, with many demanding the downfall of the ruling Al Khalifa family" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/specialcoverage/bahrain-protests-2011/
INITDESC: INDIV "protesters" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/specialcoverage/bahrain-protests-2011/
PARTOFF: "Following a violent response from the security forces and the death of a protester, mainstream opposition groups began to take part and numbers swelled" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/specialcoverage/bahrain-protests-2011/, "hundreds were arrested" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/specialcoverage/bahrain-protests-2011/, "small protests continue to take place in Bahrain on an almost daily basis" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/specialcoverage/bahrain-protests-2011/
OUTDESC:
"-Economic concessions by King Hamad[138]
-Release of political prisoners[139]
-Negotiations with Shia representatives[140]
-GCC intervention at the request of the Government of Bahrain
-Head of the National Security Apparatus removed from post[141]
-Formation of a committee to implement BICI report recommendations" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_Spring
NARR: Arab Spring: Bahrain is a democracy campaign aiming to effect political reform in Bahrain, initiated by Bahranian individuals. Digital activity consisted of Facebook, Twitter and news coverage. Offline activity consisted of protests throughout Bahrain. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a crowd-based network of protestors. As of July 3, 2013, the campaign is partially successful, because protests are ongoing but the government has made concessions to protestors. RM

TITLE: Against Road Through TIPNIS Park
GOALDESC: "demanding an end to the road project." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/10/bolivia-development-at-what-cost-new-conflict-over-tipnis-road/
INITDESC: FORMAL "Indigenous organizations, TIPNIS inhabitants and their supporters began a new long march"  - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isiboro_S%C3%A9cure_National_Park_and_Indigenous_Territory
TARGDESC: "Bolivia's government insists on the benefits of a road " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/10/bolivia-development-at-what-cost-new-conflict-over-tipnis-road/
PARTOFF: "TIPNIS inhabitants and their supporters began a new long march on April 27, 2012, from Trinidad to La Paz ", "after a large march of indigenous peoples and protestors arrived in La Paz," - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/10/bolivia-development-at-what-cost-new-conflict-over-tipnis-road/
OUTDESC: "The decision is expected to put the highway on hold for three years, until the end of 2015. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/05/10/bolivia-development-at-what-cost-new-conflict-over-tipnis-road/
NARR: Against Road Through TIPNIS Park is a rights of ethnic minorities and immigrants campaign aiming to stopping the construction of a road through indigenous territory and a national park with the initiator(s), indigenous organizations, local inhabitants, and their supporters, based in Bolivia and the target(s), the Bolivian government. Digital activity consisted of a Twitter hashtag and Facebook group, as well as a video and blogs. Offline activity consisted of a large protest march 600 kilometers to La Paz, Bolivia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a large (approximately thousand-strong) group, more informal and individual than formal. As of May 19, 2013 the campaign is successful, since Bolivian President Evo Morales passed a bill declaring the land untouchable. DS

TITLE: Against Forced Evictions in Rio
GOALDESC: "fight forced evictions caused by development projects in preparation for the events"  - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/09/06/brazil-road-to-world-cup-and-olympics-paved-with-forced-evictions/
INITDESC: FORMAL and INFORMAL "WITNESS has partnered with Habitat International Coalition and several local organizations" - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2011/09/06/brazil-road-to-world-cup-and-olympics-paved-with-forced-evictions/

NARR: Against Forced Evictions in Rio is an economic justice campaign aiming to protest forced evacuations with the initiator(s), informal groups, based in Brazil and the target(s), the government based in Brazil. Digital activity consisted of videos and blogs. Offline activity consisted of training activists to make videos. The structure of the campaign can best be described as professional and organized. As of June 28, 2013 the campaign is over, without success, as the groups were removed. KS

TITLE: Against Bus Fare Increases in Teresina

INITDESC: "Since the beginning of the year, thousands of students have been protesting against the increase in bus fares in the city of Teresina, the capital of the state of Piaui. ", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/01/14/brazil-student-protests-bus-fare-piaui/
PARTOFF: "The demonstrators are forcefully kept down by the RONE (specially trained troops) of the Military Police. They have reacted by setting fire to at least one bus, and dozens of students have been arrested.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/01/14/brazil-student-protests-bus-fare-piaui/

Digital activity consisted of videos, blogs and Twitter, and social networks. Offline activity consisted of protests. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a very loose network. As of June 18, 2013 the campaign's success and status are unknown. KS

TITLE: Against Bhutan Tobacco Law
GOALDESC: "Amend the Tobacco Control Act", http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/09/201292095920757761.html
INITDESC: INDIV, "This resulted in a public outcry, and a Facebook group was created called "Amend the Tobacco Control Act". The group had over 2,900 members, and was the first show of dissent in a country that adopted democracy in 2008 after 100 years of absolute monarchy", http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/09/201292095920757761.html
TARGDESC: "The government emphasises improving people’s happiness while relying on four pillars of development - good governance, natural environment, sustainable growth and cultural values", http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/09/201292095920757761.html
OUTDESC: "Under public pressure, the parliament amended the act and passed the Tobacco Control (Amendment) Act in January 2012. The amended Act has increased the permissible amounts of tobacco that can be imported for personal consumption.", http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/09/201292095920757761.html
NARR: This is a health campaign aiming to amend Bhutan's tobacco law, initiated by Bhutanese. Digital activity consisted of blogging, a Facebook group, and news coverage. There was no offline activity. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an informal network. As of July 14, 2013, the campaign is partially successful because the government amended the tobacco act but amendments were not entirely acceptable. RM

TITLE: Against Changes to McGill Language Program Consolidation
GOALDESC: "[against] McGill's plan to consolidate four language departments - Italian, German, Italian and Russian/Slavic - into a single discipline, while restricting access to those courses to students enrolled in language study programs" - http://www2.canada.com/montrealgazette/columnists/story.html?id=079c5ac0-d680-4c92-813b-3f860b537f25
