TITLE: Against Self-Aggrandizing "Epal" by Politicians
GOALDESC: "against the common practice of Filipino politicians to attach their names to government projects that are funded or assisted by their office." http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/30/philippines-online-shame-campaign-against-epal-politicians/
INITDESC: INDIV "netizens launched an online shame campaign against the common practice of Filipino politicians to attach their names to government projects that are funded or assisted by their office." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/30/philippines-online-shame-campaign-against-epal-politicians/
TARGDESC: "These politicians are labelled “epal,” a Filipino slang term meaning “attention grabber,” for using public funds and programs to promote themselves through tarpaulins and other publicity materials." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/30/philippines-online-shame-campaign-against-epal-politicians/
OUTDESC: "it looks like the public may finally see fewer streamers and other materials with the images and names of politicians claiming credit for government projects" - http://www.philstar.com/opinion/2013/02/15/909003/editorial-stopping-epal
NARR: Against Self-Aggrandizing "Epal" by Politicians is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at eliminating politicians' self-promotion through public programs, with initiators, concerned netizens, based in the Philippines, and targets, self-promoting politicians, based in the Philippines. Digital activity consisted of tens of thousands of Facebook likes, several thousand tweets, a blog, and videos. There was no indication of offline activity. The structure of the campaign is individual action centered around the community-created anti-epal group. As of May 19, 2013, the campaign has achieved partial success, since government organizations have issued warning about epal. JL

TITLE: Welcome to Palestine 2012
GOALDESC: "Online Campaign to Protest Gov't's Digital 'Snooping Bill' Turns Nasty", http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/23216/youngest-member-elected-canadian-parliament-leads-digital-privacy-issues
INITDESC: INDIV, "The online protests began as a lighthearted Twitter campaign hashtagged #TellVicEverything. Users bombarded Toews's account with tongue-in-cheek tweets that purported to detail the minutiae of their daily lives.", http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/23216/youngest-member-elected-canadian-parliament-leads-digital-privacy-issues
OUTDESC: "The bill was widely opposed within Canada, particularly after Public Safety Minister Vic Toews told an opposition MP that he could "either stand with us or with the child pornographers" during a debate. The government ultimately withdrew the bill in 2013, citing that opposition. Similar legislation had been unsuccessfully proposed in the past, by both the Liberal and Conservative parties in Canada, and mirrored legislation introduced in other countries.", http://techpresident.com/news/wegov/23216/youngest-member-elected-canadian-parliament-leads-digital-privacy-issues
NARR: Welcome to Palestine 2012 is a campaign opposing violence and armed conflict aimed to challenge the Israeli "siege" of the Palestinian Occupied Territories. The initiator, Palestine Justice Network, appear to be Palestinian (maybe not based in-country) and the target is the Israeli government. Digital activity consisted of a website coordinating visitors. Offline activity consisted of a planned protest and meetings in Bethlehem, Israel. The structure of the campaign can best be described as loosely organized by an informal organization. As of 19 May 2013, the campaign is unsuccessful; fewer than 30 of an estimated 1,500 planned attendees made it to Bethlehem for the event. RM

TITLE: Against NATO Base in Ulyanovsk
GOALDESC: "Proposed NATO Hub in Ulyanovsk Sparks Protests, a wave of online indignation that has since spread to the streets, leading to hunger strikes and anti-NATO marches in Ulyanovsk and Moscow.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/04/13/russia-proposed-nato-hub-in-ulyanovsk-sparks-protests/
INITDESC: FORMAL, "The perpetual Communist Party (KPRF) leader Gennady Ziuganov was not convinced, tweeting a few days later: “The NATO base in Ulyanovsk – presents from Putin to the USA for recognizing [Russia's presidential] elections”", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/04/13/russia-proposed-nato-hub-in-ulyanovsk-sparks-protests/
PARTOFF: "Rogozin was reacting to a wave of online indignation that has since spread to the streets, leading to hunger strikes and anti-NATO marches in Ulyanovsk and Moscow", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/04/13/russia-proposed-nato-hub-in-ulyanovsk-sparks-protests/
OUTDESC: "The Russian government has given approval for the United States and its NATO allies to use a Russian air base in the Volga city of Ulyanovsk as a hub for transits to and from Afghanistan.", http://en.ria.ru/russia/20120629/174312840.html
NARR: Against NATO Base in Ulyanovsk is an opposing violence and armed conflict campaign aiming to oppose to plans for a NATO transport hub based in Russia with the initiator(s), the perpetual Communist Party (KPRF), based in Russia and the target(s), both NATO and their own government, based in Russia. Offline activity consisted of hunger strikes and anti-NATO marches in Ulyanovsk and Moscow. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a formal crowd of communists and nationalists for strikes and marches. As of May 19, 2013, the campaign is not achieved since The Russian government has given approval for the United States and its NATO allies to use a Russian air base in the Volga city of Ulyanovsk as a hub for transits to and from Afghanistan. SL

TITLE: M23 Movement
GOALDESC: " protest a third term for incumbent President Wade. " - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/03/senegal-a-week-of-living-dangerously/
INITDESC: FORMAL "Although several members of the opposition movement, the Movement June 23 (M23), have called for peaceful and non-violent demonstrations," - https://www.facebook.com/pages/Mouvement-du-23-Juin/227159273971662?id=227159273971662&sk=info
TARGDESC: "President Wade", "to target people close to Wade, notably Farba Senghor, a consultant well known to Wade." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/03/senegal-a-week-of-living-dangerously/
MAP: "Some even used to Google maps to locate his residence" - https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=339612212726367&set=a.228103983877191.57750.227159273971662&type=3&theater
PARTOFF: "protesters have taken to the streets and sometimes violently expressed their anger" "None of this bodes well for the big rally on January 31." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/03/senegal-a-week-of-living-dangerously/
OUTDESC: "After the first round vote, Abdoulaye Wade acknowledged on 27 February 2012 that he had failed to win a majority in the election and would have to face a run-off.[36] He subsequently lost the second round of voting, held on 25 March 2012, to the opposition candidate Macky Sall; Sall had received the backing of all of the candidates who were defeated in the first round, and he defeated Wade by a wide margin. Sall succeeded Wade as President on 2 April 2012." - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdoulaye_Wade#2012_election_for_third_term
NARR: M23 Movement is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at denying President Wade a third term, with the initiators, a coalition of parties and citizens, based in Senegal, and the target, President Wade, based in Senegal. Digital activity consisted of ten thousand likes on Facebook, tweets about the protests, a video of the protests, and the use of mapping software. Offline activity consisted of protests made up of at least hundreds of people. The structure of the campaign is a coalition made up of groups that oppose the president. As of May 19, 2013, the campaign achieved partial success, since they failed to force President Wade from elections, but he was voted out of office during the elections. JL

TITLE: Panasonic Workers Demand Better Conditions
GOALDESC: "demanding higher pay and better working conditions" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/1729-The-Straits-Times-.docx
INITDESC: INDIV "MORE than 100 disgruntled Panasonic factory workers from China have started an online petition" - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/1729-The-Straits-Times-.docx
TARGDESC: "action be taken against their labour agent for over-charging them", "Panasonic Asia Pacific said it has not received any official letter or petition from the workers." - http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/1729-The-Straits-Times-.docx
EPET: "MORE than 100 disgruntled Panasonic factory workers from China have started an online petition " - http://www.google.com/url?q=http://digital-activism.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/1729-The-Straits-Times-.docx&usd=2&usg=ALhdy28L9bcSTgEPl55JTihvlrk4a1f1lQ
OUTDESC: "To supplement her income, her employer has “generously” given out, in the past, additional allowance of S$150 for housing and S$30 for transportation. With a stipend of S$680, her head is hardly above water." - http://sgvoize.wordpress.com/2013/03/13/panasonic-singapore-exploits-foreign-workers/
NARR: Panasonic Workers Demand Better Conditions is an economic justice campaign aiming to improve working conditions and increase pay for workers with the initiator(s), individuals workers supported by a formal humanitarian group, based in China and Singapore and the target(s), the Panasonic factory in which the workers are employed based in Singapore. Digital activity consisted of an e-petition and a blog. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as an amateur campaign. As of May 19, 2013 the campaign is over, without any success--no changes have been made to the working conditions or pay. KS

TITLE: Urging Punishment on Excessive Copyright Fees
GOALDESC: "The Ministry of Culture appealed to SOZA, insisting that student graduation parties were for parents and teachers and could not be considered public events – hence, there was no reason for SOZA to introduce a fee for them.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/28/slovakia-protesting-sozas-newest-copyright-fees/
INITDESC: FORMAL, "The Ministry of Culture appealed to SOZA, insisting that student graduation parties were for parents and teachers and could not be considered public events – hence, there was no reason for SOZA to introduce a fee for them.", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/28/slovakia-protesting-sozas-newest-copyright-fees/
TARGDESC: "the Slovak Performing and Mechanical Rights Society (SOZA)", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/28/slovakia-protesting-sozas-newest-copyright-fees/
PARTOFF: "On October 25, a small rally [sk; images, video] took place in front of the Ministry of Culture. About a dozen anti-SOZA activists", http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/28/slovakia-protesting-sozas-newest-copyright-fees/
OUTDESC: "SOZA declared [sk] that “due to special social character” of such parties, they will not be charged – “even though the law allows SOZA to ask for payment.”, http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/10/28/slovakia-protesting-sozas-newest-copyright-fees/
NARR: Urging Punishment on Excessive Copyright Fees is a anti-copyright fee campaign aiming to renounce excessive copyright fees with the initiator(s), citizens, based in Slovakia and the target(s), SOZA, a business, based in Slovakia. Digital activity consisted of a website and blogs. Offline activity consisted of a rally, with no reported numbers. The structure of the campaign can best be described as loose. As of April 23, 2013, the campaign is over having achieved success.  SOZA agreed not to seek the payments. KS

TITLE: For Marijuana Legalization in Tunisia
GOALDESC: The campaign(s) to save the Narcondam Hornbill has been commendable. For example, Conservation India had been running an active campaign urging citizens to take up the cause and petition members of the MOEF and the National Board for Wildlife (NBWL). They had also launched a video campaign to generate awareness about the issue and to mobilize public opinion in favour of preserving the island's ecosystem.
INITDESC: FORMAL "The campaign(s) to save the Narcondam Hornbill has been commendable. For example, Conservation India had been running an active campaign urging citizens to take up the cause and petition members of the MOEF and the National Board for Wildlife (NBWL). They had also launched a video campaign to generate awareness about the issue and to mobilize public opinion in favour of preserving the island's ecosystem." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/09/19/india-hurrah-for-hornbills-defence-project-stalled-in-narcondam/
BLOG: "Bloggers also had their opinion about the legalization of marijuana in Tunisia" – http://nawaat.org/portail/2011/12/05/depenalisation-du-cannabis/
OUTDESC: The Ministry of Environment & Forests (MoEF) has rejected a proposal by the Indian Coast Guard to erect a RADAR installation on Narcondam Island in the Andamans.  - http://www.conservationindia.org/news/narcondam-hornbill-receives-a-reprieve
NARR: For Marijuana Legalization in Tunisia is a democratic campaign aiming to legalize marijuana in Tunisia through several specific demands. The initiator(s) are Tunisian Facebook users. Digital activity consisted of two Facebook groups, Twitter use and a YouTube video. Offline activity consisted of a protest in Bardo, Tunisia. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a large, loosely organized crowd-based operation. As of 19 May 2013, the campaign is unsuccessful because marijuana-smoking in Tunisia is still illegal with harsh penalties. RM

TITLE: Against Amendment to Turkey's Animal Protection Law
GOALDESC: "against a draft law on Sunday that would make changes to Turkey's Animal Protection Law No. 5199, seeking to introduce practices currently used in other countries such as collecting stray animals from the streets and euthanizing members of the “excess” population.", "in protest of the planned changes. " - http://actipedia.org/project/thousands-march-against-amendment-animal-protection-law
INITDESC: INDIV "Thousands of animal rights activists marched against", "Bünyamin Salman, a member of the Animal Party, said what the government is attempting"  - http://actipedia.org/project/thousands-march-against-amendment-animal-protection-law
TARGDESC: "Bünyamin Salman, a member of the Animal Party, said what the government is attempting is reminiscent of what the Committee of Union and Progress (CUP) government did 102 years ago" - http://actipedia.org/project/thousands-march-against-amendment-animal-protection-law
PARTOFF: "Thousands of animal rights activists marched against", "More than 10,000 people marched in ?stanbul's Taksim neighborhood, and many others walked in 13 other cities, in protest of the planned changes. " - http://actipedia.org/project/thousands-march-against-amendment-animal-protection-law
OUTDESC: "Turkey’s parliamentary commission has withdrawn a draft law for further amendment on Tuesday that would make changes to Turkey’s Animal Protection Law No. 5199 following a series of protests across Turkey." - http://occupyforanimals.wix.com/strays-of-turkey#!after-the-protests/csp6
NARR: Against Amendment to Turkey's Animal Protection Law is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at stopping a bill that would collect stray animals, with initiators, animal-rights activists, based in Turkey, and targets, officials, based in Turkey. Digital activity consisted of several online petitions, tweets, and a website. Offline activity consisted of protests of several thousand people. The structure of the campaign is a coalition of various animal-rights groups (unnamed) and animal-rights activists. As of May 19, 2013, the campaign has not achieved success, since officials have not responded to protests or petitions. JL

TITLE: Against Maasai Eviction in Loliondo
GOALDESC: "protesting against plans to force Maasai pastoralists off their land to make way for game hunting by royals from the United Arab Emirates." - http://allafrica.com/stories/201209090290.html
INITDESC: FORMAL "The Coalition of Feminist Civil Society (FEMACT), Tanzania Land Alliance (TALA), the Pastoralists Indigenous Non-Government Organization (PINGOS) Forum and the Ngorongoro Non-Government Organization Network (NGONET) have released a joint statement protesting" - http://allafrica.com/stories/201209090290.html
TARGDESC: "The joint statement presented by Ms Neema Duma of FEMACT, a Community Based Organizations said a total of seven villages with a population of 48,000 stand to be affected by the state's recent move to clear 1500 square kilometers of land in Loliondo." - http://allafrica.com/stories/201209090290.html
EPET: "Nearly 750,000 people have signed the online petition" - http://allafrica.com/stories/201209090290.html, "Avaaz has posted a petition on its website to help the Masai and already has more than 1.2m signatures." - http://news.sky.com/story/1074505/tribesmen-evicted-for-wealthy-lion-hunters
OUTDESC: "He said the Government was not worried about the leaders plans to resign or intimidated by the actions of NGOs." - http://news.sky.com/story/1074505/tribesmen-evicted-for-wealthy-lion-hunters
NARR: Against Maasai Eviction in Loliondo is a rights of ethnic minorities and immigrants campaign aiming to protest the Tanzania Government's move to evict Masai pastoralists from their lands. The initiator(s) are several NGOs, based in Tanzania and the target is the Tanzanian Government. Digital activity consisted of an online petition and use of Facebook, Twitter, and email. Offline activity consisted of refusal by 2 villages to submit their land certificates, in Ololosokwan and Engaresambu, Tanzania. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a coalition of various NGOs working together to generate support for the issue.  As of May 19, 2013 the campaign is partially successful, because although the progress toward eviction has not seemed to cease, high level officials have denied allegations to evict the Maasai, responding to their concerns at least. DS

TITLE: Free Ex.ua
GOALDESC: "criticizing the government for going after Ex.ua and calling for its restoration." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/07/ukraine-netizens-react-to-popular-file-sharing-websites-shutdown/
INITDESC: INDIV "many netizens criticizing the government for going after Ex.ua and calling for its restoration." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/07/ukraine-netizens-react-to-popular-file-sharing-websites-shutdown/
TARGDESC: "Ex.ua's shutdown by the Ministry of the Interior, " "the government's action against Ex.ua "- http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/07/ukraine-netizens-react-to-popular-file-sharing-websites-shutdown/
HACK: "the Ministry's website went down and remained periodically inaccessible due to “an increased number of visitors and possible DDoS attacks” [uk]." , "By that time many Twitter, Vkontakte and Facebook users were actively sharing detailed instructions [ru] on how to overload the servers of selected websites. The target list included websites of Ukraine’s President Victor Yanukovych, the pro-presidential Party of Regions, the Cabinet of Ministers, the Parliament, and others." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/07/ukraine-netizens-react-to-popular-file-sharing-websites-shutdown/
PARTOFF: "People are protesting against the shutdown of Ex.ua outside the Interior Ministry in Kyiv. " , "While many echoed her plea, others decided to take action both offline (photos of the Feb. 1 protest in Kyiv are here) and online." - http://globalvoicesonline.org/2012/02/07/ukraine-netizens-react-to-popular-file-sharing-websites-shutdown/
OUTDESC: "You can use anonymously the server saving the files." - http://www.ex.ua/
NARR: Free Ex.ua is a information and expression campaign aiming to restore the file-sharing site ex.ua, with the initiators, ex.ua and various "netizens," based in the Ukraine, and the targets, the Ukrainian president, the president's party, the Cabinet of Ministers, and parliament, based in the Ukraine. Digital activity consisted of campaign-related tweets, social-network sharing, and blog posts. The structure of the campaign appears to be unassociated individuals responding to an organizing call to action from ex.ua. As of May 19, 2013, the campaign was completely successful, since ex.ua was restored and continues to operate. JL

TITLE: Justice for the Pavlichenko Family

NARR: Justice for the Pavlichenko Family is a democracy and rule of law campaign aimed at freeing a father and sun who were convicted of killing a judge, with the initiators, soccer fans, based in the Ukraine, and the target, the Kiev appeals court, based in the Ukraine. Digital activity consisted of likes on a Facebook page, an online petition, blogs, and videos. Offline activity consisted of protests of several thousand people in Kiev. TITLE: Boycott Rush
GOALDESC: "On Friday morning, HuffPost blogger Krystal Ball called for a boycott of companies that sponsor the Limbaugh show. Participating Twitter users are rallying around the hashtag #BoycottRush, and two Facebook pages calling for a boycott had garnered more than 18,000 and 6,000 Likes by Saturday morning.", http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/03/rush-limbaugh-boycott-reddit-twitter-facebook_n_1317698.html?
INITDESC: INDIV, "On Friday morning, HuffPost blogger Krystal Ball called for a boycott of companies that sponsor the Limbaugh show. Participating Twitter users are rallying around the hashtag #BoycottRush, and two Facebook pages calling for a boycott had garnered more than 18,000 and 6,000 Likes by Saturday morning.", http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/03/rush-limbaugh-boycott-reddit-twitter-facebook_n_1317698.html?
TARGDESC: "On Friday morning, HuffPost blogger Krystal Ball called for a boycott of companies that sponsor the Limbaugh show. Participating Twitter users are rallying around the hashtag #BoycottRush, and two Facebook pages calling for a boycott had garnered more than 18,000 and 6,000 Likes by Saturday morning.", http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/03/rush-limbaugh-boycott-reddit-twitter-facebook_n_1317698.html?
EPET: " A petition attached to the page attracted close to 50,000 signatures in less than 24 hours," - http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/03/rush-limbaugh-boycott-reddit-twitter-facebook_n_1317698.html?
OUTDESC: " as of March 8, up to forty-five advertisers had withdrawn or suspended their advertising on the show,[99] and two radio stations, KPUA in Hilo, Hawaii, and WBEC in Pittsfield, Massachusetts, announced they would no longer broadcast the show....in June 2013, at which point many of the advertisers had long since returned and those that had not had been replaced.[102] Competing networks Cumulus Media and Dial Global both blamed the controversy for advertising losses at their networks; in Cumulus's case, it was also a factor in the company's decision to drop Limbaugh from all of their stations (including several of Limbaugh's top-10 market affiliates, most of which were former ABC owned-and-operated stations) when the company's bulk carriage contract with Limbaugh expires at the end of 2013", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rush_Limbaugh_Show
NARR: Boycott Rush is a gender rights campaign aiming to encourage companies to boycott Rush Limbaugh's show with the initiator(s), individuals, based in the USA and the target(s), Rush Limbaugh, based in the USA. Digital activity consisted of Twitter, Facebook, forums, an e-petition and blogs. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a tight coalition of people concerned with the boycott. As of June 3, 2013 the campaign is over, having achieved success as companies refused to advertise with Limbaugh. KS

TITLE: Against Genetically Modified Grain in Kashi Cereal
GOALDESC: "foods with GMOs should be labeled as such" - http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/27/kashi-gmo-use-controversy_n_1456748.html
INITDESC: FORMAL "It was back in October 2011 that farm policy watch-dog organization the Cornucopia Institute released a report called "Cereal Crimes," alleging that the "all-natural" cereal brand Kashi uses genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in some of its products." - http://www.cornucopia.org/contact/
TARGDESC: "In response, Kashi -- which is owned by Kellogg's -- made an attempt at damage-control by releasing a YouTube video featuring a woman named Keegan who says she's both a Kashi team member and a nutritionist." - http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/27/kashi-gmo-use-controversy_n_1456748.html
BLOG: "Photos of the note began popping up on Facebook pages and food blogs" - http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/industries/food/story/2012-04-29/kashi-natural-claims/54616576/1
VIDEO: "the Cornucopia Institute quickly fired back at the the video by posting a rebuttal on their website." - http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/27/kashi-gmo-use-controversy_n_1456748.html
OUTDESC: "Kashi's DeSouza says that by 2015, all new Kashi products will "contain at least 70% USDA organic certified ingredients."" - http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/industries/food/story/2012-04-29/kashi-natural-claims/54616576/1
NARR: Against Genetically Modified Grain in Kashi Cereal is a human health campaign aiming to protest mislabeling with the initiator(s), individuals and a formal group, based in the USA and the target(s), Kashi, based in the USA. Digital activity consisted of Facebook, blogs, and video. Offline activity consisted of phone calls and a press release. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a formal campaign by a loose coalition. As of June 5, 2013, the campaign is ended, with partial success as Kashi promises to be at least 70% GMO free in a few years. KS

TITLE: Jamie Dimon: Resign from Federal Reserve Board
GOALDESC: "JP Morgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon must resign from the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York." - http://techpresident.com/news/22238/former-chief-economist-imf-uses-changeorg-petition-ny-fed-remove-jpmorgan-chase-ceo-jamie
INITDESC: INDIV "Johnson, a British economist who's a longtime professor at MIT, established the petition " - http://techpresident.com/news/22238/former-chief-economist-imf-uses-changeorg-petition-ny-fed-remove-jpmorgan-chase-ceo-jamie
TARGDESC: " Jamie Dimon must immediately resign his post at the New York Federal Reserve Bank. OUTDESC:
"Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, a position that had stirred some controversy after the bank’s big trading loss last year.

Mr. Dimon’s three-year term, his second on the board, expired at the end of December. While there are no official term limits, it is common for New York Fed directors to serve no more than two terms." - http://dealbook.nytimes.com/2013/01/08/dimon-leaves-new-york-fed-board-as-his-term-ends/
NARR: Jamie Dimon: Resign from Federal Reserve Board is an economic justice campaign aiming to encourage an individual to resign from the Fed Reserve with the initiator(s), and individual, based in the USA and the target(s), a business, based in the USA. Digital activity consisted of e-petitions. Offline activity was not present. The structure of the campaign can best be described as formal. As of June 4, 2013 the campaign is over.  Dimon did not resign, but left at the end of his term. KS

TITLE: Against SOPA/PIPA
GOALDESC: "On January 18, 2012, a series of coordinated protests occurred against two proposed laws in the United States Congress—the Stop Online Piracy Act (SOPA) and the PROTECT IP Act (PIPA). ", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protests_against_SOPA_and_PIPA
INITDESC: FORMAL, "The move to a formal protest was initiated when some websites, including Reddit and the English Wikipedia, considered temporarily closing their content and redirecting users to a message opposing the proposed legislation", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protests_against_SOPA_and_PIPA
TARGDESC: "against two proposed laws in the United States Congress", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protests_against_SOPA_and_PIPA
EPET: "a petition at Google recorded over 4.5 million signatures" - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protests_against_SOPA_and_PIPA
MICBLOG: Twitter recorded at least 2.4 million SOPA-related tweets
OUTDESC: "By January 20, 2012, the political environment regarding both bills had shifted significantly. The bills were removed from further voting, ostensibly to be revised to take into consideration the issues raised,[5] but according to The New York Times probably "shelved"[5] following a "flight away from the bill".[5] Opposers noted the bills had been "indefinitely postponed" but cautioned they were "not dead" and "would return", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protests_against_SOPA_and_PIPA
NARR: Against SOPA/PIPA is a freedom of information campaign aiming to stop hurting freedom of speech online with the initiator(s), formal groups, based in the USA and the target(s), Congress, based in the USA. Digital activity consisted of Twitter, blogs, e-petition, and websites. Offline activity consisted of protests. The structure of the campaign can best be described as a tight, formal network of formal groups taking aligned action. As of June 3, 2013 the campaign is over, having achieved success as the laws were dropped. KS
